I loved the first 3 seasons of DA. I thought it was a wonderful show. Although it clearly was in many ways a soap opera, it still had powerful characters, interesting plot lines, and dealt with important issues that were facing those characters during an interesting time in history. I just finished watching Season 4 on TV (didn't actually buy the DVD). It's sad to say that the show is almost unrecognizable from what it was before. It has devolved into the worse kind of soap opera - overused/reused meaningless and boring plot lines, characters showing no personal growth and behaving in uncharacteristic ways, and no real movement in the story.  The characters (for the most part) are no longer interesting and the plot lines have become cliched. It is so very sad to see this happen to a great show. The magic is gone. The amazing spark and energy this show had have evaporated.

A few examples of the many problems:
-Reversing character growth - At the end of Season 3, Thomas had been helped by several DA people Anna, Bates, and Jimmy among them. He appeared to be growing as a person and starting to move beyond some of his earlier ways. Well, here comes Season 4 and Thomas is right back where he was before in being a scheming jerk. Really? There was nothing more interesting you could have come up with for this character other than a rewind? And on a related but more minor note - he keeps saying, what would appear to others anyway as, weird things to Mrs. Baxter about "messages" and "information" out where everyone can hear him. It seems odd to behave that way if you want to keep blackmailing someone.
-Reusing old plot lines - the Thomas stuff above is one example of this. But they even felt compelled to get Edna the maid back again to go after Tom. I thought we were past that. Let's move on. And poor Tom can't catch a break. Can we possibly get off the "Tom doesn't belong" theme?  I can understand him questioning himself, especially at things like the house party where he is forced to deal with lots of the "upper class" stuff he is not familiar with - however, at this point I think the family would be working hard to make him feel at home. A few kind words from Robert (which I think he would have gotten in Season 3) would go a long way. But in this season the goal seems to be to maximize strife, even if people have to behave in ways they normally wouldn't, to get it. Then when Tom meets a nice teacher, we start to think - oh good, a nice woman who can perhaps help Tom think of a romantic life beyond Sybil. But no, what does she do? She too makes Tom feel bad for being an "outsider" to the family, and makes him question why he is living with them - why he has given up who he used to be, etc, etc.  At the end of Season 3, I felt that Tom was going to be a big part of helping the family come to terms with the new post-WWI world - he has experience with both the aristocracy and with the working class - he could help them bridge to the new reality where those lines are going to be less harshly drawn. But instead of that - we have him constantly hating himself and full of self doubt. Again - he is not moving forward. And then repeating the plot line of again him being in an awkward situation with a woman in the house (when he gave the tour to Sarah) when the rest of the family is away - had yet more echoes of Edna. Enough already.
-What should be subplots have taken too much of center stage - the love rectangle of Daisy, Ivy, Jimmy, and Alfred was just so high school it became boring and ridiculous. Too much time was spent on it.
-Characters behaving in unusual ways - The banter between Violet and Isabelle is usually so very subtle and yet so very interesting to watch - by the end of Season 4 they were basically insulting each other outright - not the way I think they would behave. Also, I'm tired of Thomas running to Robert with stories and Robert believing them!  Robert knows that Thomas has been a jerk in the past (he was almost fired for stealing) - why would Robert take anything he says at face value? Robert has been too quick to believe negative things about staff he knows well. He's not such a fool as that.
-The attack on Anna - Seeing such a thing happen to Anna was very very difficult. And to make it worse - it seemed like just a plot convenience - they wanted something to inject some drama/conflict  into the show . Not to say that something like that couldn't have happened - it could have - but the whole scenario seemed a bit unrealistic. It just felt like someone said - "hmmm, we need something dramatic and intense" and they chose that. An unfortunate choice.  (Also, I think Bates would have guessed the nature of what happened to Anna right away - in the expanse of a couple of hours she goes from perfectly normal to bruised in the face and unable to tolerate her husband's touch. Hmmm, doesn't take much to figure out what might have happened to her.)
-An overall feeling of blahness - most of the plots are just not that interesting anymore. Way too much focus on romance stuff. In fact that was almost every plot:  Daisy/Alfred/Ivy/Jimmy, Rose/Jack Ross, Edith/Gregson, Mary/Tony/Evelyn/Charles, Carson/lost love, Tom/Edna, Tom/Sarah Bunting.  There is not enough substance anymore.

However, the 4th season has not been without some quality moments:
1. Watching Mary and Isabelle work through their grief in the first few episodes was heart wrenching. I felt they gave excellent performances in those shows.
2. Tom and Mary building a relationship, Tom helping her to start living life again. That was nice. I wish there was more of that in the later episodes.
3. The scene with Mary, Tom, and Isabelle in the nursery sharing their feelings about their lost spouses.
4. There were still many places where the characters shined as the did in Seasons 1-3 (just not enough).

I hope they can pull things back together for Season 5. The history these people are living through is still a very interesting time of rapid change and challenges for the world. They need to get back to their roots of this show being about the family making their path through those times and challenges.

The 4 season of Downton Abbey was awesome and had some amazing surprises and some horrible twists and turns! It picks up after Matthew has died and now someone has gone missing. This poor family has had a lot of hardship, but also had a lot of fun in season 4. I cannot wait for season 5!!!

Perhaps there were budgetary constraints? I anticipated over the top scenery for a Buckingham palace setting as in those times things were indeed most ostentatious!  The Character Jack Ross who played love interest of Lady rose made things sizzle and a intimate love scene would have been tantalizing indeed.!!!

The fourth season of "Downton Abbey" (not including two Christmas specials) attempts to recapture some of the original spark that made its first season such a success, and comes about as close as its ever going to get. After the trauma of World War I and the deaths of two beloved family members (sadly necessary due to the actors leaving for other projects), the show can settle down and become the frothy soap-opera that its always been at heart. Only now, no one is pretending that its anything else.

SPOILERS BELOW

Set in the mid-1920s, the fourth season opens with Mrs OBrian sneaking away in the night, another causality of an actress deciding to call it quits  though in this case, at least she made it out alive  and Countess Grantham starting the search for another ladys maid.  Fellowes wisely decides to open the season six months after Matthews death in a car accident, thus sparing us the rawness of his passing (it was painful enough with Sybil), and depicting Mary as a young widow who believes she has little left to live for.

From start to finish this season is packed full of your favourite melodrama tropes: love triangles, out-of-wedlock pregnancy, murder, rape, doomed relationships, half-orphaned children, impassioned declarations of love  its all here, and its embraced with a whole-hearted awareness of how silly it all is. And I honestly say that with affection. I don't watch Downton Abbey for historical accuracy or sophisticated plots or  heck  even character development. I watch because its light, glossy, pleasant fluff. No apologies.

But season four turns out to be something of a mixed bag. Though I enjoyed the depiction of Marys movement from bleak despair to a renewed interest in life, I wasn't at all impressed by her new bevy of suitors (in fact most of the time I couldn't even tell them apart). Hapless Moseley and long-suffering Edith are once again put through the wringer, but this time they face their tribulations with spunk and fortitude, giving audiences a good reason to cheer them on.

Poor Tom Branson used to be such a firecracker, yet now he keeps falling miserably into the machinations of calculating women, and whatever character development was afforded to Thomas has now been obliterated in favour of once more making him Downtons resident puppet-master (how he still has a job is beyond me). The tedious love triangle between Daisy, Ivy and Alfred continues to stretch on downstairs, boring everyone including the participants, and poor Daisy keeps shutting down the prospects that open up all around her (Gwen was allowed to leave Downton in order to pursue career opportunities elsewhere  why not Daisy?)

Yet contrary to what most viewers seem to think, I quite enjoy Cousin Rose and her light-hearted hijinks, though Lord and Lady Grantham continue to be the most oblivious people on the planet. Im sure that Cora used to be the sharpest and most observant member of the household  now shes an utter dimwit who consistently trusts the wrong people and doesnt notice the most obvious occurrences happening right under her nose.

Something truly lovely comes out of the Violet/Isabel relationship  at the start of the show they were so at odds with one another, and now something very close to a prickly friendship has formed (though neither one of them would ever admit it). That goes ditto for Mary and Annas friendship of quiet respect and support, and of course, the platonic marriage that exists between Carson and Mrs Hughes; surely the backbone of the entire household.

All that said, there is one particularly dark point during the course of the season that was met with outrage and disgust from Downton viewers, and that was the controversial rape of one of its most popular characters at the hands of a visiting valet. Anna has been the moral centre of Downton from the shows inception, and though we (mercifully) don't see the act itself, the build-up and the fallout is harrowing enough, coming as quite a slap in the face to unsuspecting viewers. That Anna was chosen as the victim of such a crime was a strategic ploy, knowing that she was loved and admired by the audience. Would the controversy have been as pronounced, if this storyline had played out between  lets say  Jimmy and Ivy? I doubt it.

The aftermath is even more troublesome, for even though I give Fellowes credit for not victim-blaming Anna or glossing over the trauma that comes in the wake of a sexual assault, the storyline that follows is much more focused on Bates and *his* pain over whats happened than Anna herself (and Annas insistence that Bates not be told whats happened to her in case he takes revenge on her attacker means that every other woman in the house is put at risk because of BATESS stubbornness).

Yet despite this, there are some highpoints that make up for the sour notes. Violet giving her bereaved grand-daughter a simple I love you. The magnificent Mrs Hughes confronting Annas rapist. Mrs Patmore expressing to Daisy how proud she is of her. A fun sequence in which Rose strikes up a rapport with a village boy before scurrying to conceal her identity. Several touching scenes between siblings-in-law Tom and Mary, both lost without their spouses and struggling to support each other. And finally, Edith fighting for her right to happiness and taking matters into her own hands when it comes to the future.

There are return appearances from past characters such as Evelyn Napier, Charlie Grigg and Mr Mason, and a guest appearance from New Zealand opera singer Dame Kiri Te Kanawa as Dame Nellie Melba. Theres even a long overdue update from Gwen, not seen since the first season.

What else can be said other to say that its quintessential Downton Abbey, with everything youve come to expect. As ever, the costumes, set design, score and cinematography are a high-point, all beautifully and meticulously presented to create a visual encapsulation of the mid-1920s. Say what you will about his plotting (or the man himself) creator Julian Fellowes knows how to give his actors witty, breezy dialogue, and though I wish he would pull back on the romance (never his strong point), there are a variety of familial and platonic interactions that are as compelling as they are unique, existing between sisters, in-laws, friends, rivals, and of course masters/servants, the relationship which has always been the bedrock of this show.

I've been chewing on these thoughts for a while and it's time to write them down. This is going to be a bit of a rant. In general, I felt that the writers basically repeated all of the same gimmicks from earlier seasons. Below you'll see what I mean.

SPOILERS AHEAD!

THE REPETITION:
1. Thomas is still a jerk (Thomas is the token jerk throughout the series, but he at least enlisted our sympathies in season 2 and 3).
2. Thomas still has uncanny power to influence the thinking of the gentry he serves, and they never question it, EVER. (re: every season)
3. Uh oh, did Bates murder that guy or not?? (re: season 2 where we wondered if he had killed his wife)
4. Speaking of Bates, he certainly knows a little about unsavory activities (re: season 3 when he's in prison)
5. SCANDALOUS BABY ALERT! Fine, at least this time it was in the family instead of the servants (re: season 2, with Ethel)
6. One of the servants is trying to better themselves again, specifically Alfred (re: season 1 when Gwen became a typist)
7. Branson and Edna sittin' in a tree... but not really (re: season 3; why the heck did they even bring her back?)
8. Lots of kitchen jealousy concerning Daisy, the guy she likes, and how it's unreciprocated (re: season 1, then again in season 3)
9. Daisy once again gets an opportunity to leave Downton (re: season 3 when she was going to move in with Mr. Mason)
10. Are Carson and Mrs. Hughes going to get together or not? All these romantic overtones and no follow through (re: every season, but can't remember specifics)
11. Assorted men are pining for Mary, and they are willing to break off their other relationships for her (re: every season). On a side note, I NEVER understand why. She's a very disagreeable person, snobby as all get out, and not particularly interesting.
12. Not ANOTHER scandalous relationship! (e.g. Lady Rose with the black singer, re: every season has a nontraditional relationship that makes all the high class ninnies gasp and gossip)
13. Poor Mr. Molesley gets the short end of the stick, ALWAYS (re: every season since we first met him)
14. Poor Lady Edith can never catch a break in her love life (re: every season)
15. Good ol' rebellious Rose does everything she can to frustrate the expectations placed on her (re: season 3)

OTHER THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
1. Anna is so righteous and innocent, and then you're going to have her abused like that? Such poor taste. I felt it was a cheap trick the writers came up with to shock us all, when maybe a lesser character would've been a better choice. I think they realized they didn't have the material to keep this season interesting, so they threw this in hoping to bolster the lack of drama.
2. Thomas' motives for attacking Anna and Bates, as well as his hold over Baxter, felt completely contrived.

3. Everyone is incredibly two-dimensional. In earlier seasons we sympathized with Mary, Lord Grantham, Cora, even Thomas, and honestly most of the characters. We also learned of the depth of Daisy, Carson and Mrs. Hughes. This season, I cared about NONE of them, excepting Anna and Bates (Bates only at the beginning), Lady Edith and Isobel Crawley. All the characters have the same mannerisms they've always had (I especially loathe Cora's peering-over-the-top-of-her-glasses-crooked-smile look, even though she isn't wearing glasses), they all say and do what you expect them to, and they have all the same problems. It felt like I was just watching everyone simply do their jobs and flit about with their usual petty squabbles. I couldn't even force myself to care.

4. Branson was so FAIL in this season. Yes, I get that he needed to struggle with the death of his wife, but he was so whiney the entire season "waah, I don't fit in", "waah, I'm so lonely", "waah, should I leave or not?", "waah I don't have a political opinion any more". He starts a somewhat romantic interest with a smart girl he meets at a rally, but they don't develop that at all in the season.

5. I also get frustrated with how EASY it is for the servants to sabotage each other (Spratt sabotaging Mr. Molesley, Thomas trying to sabotage everyone and succeeding, and something with Baxter blaming someone else for a mistake that was made sewing, can't remember exactly)
6. I also didn't care about any of the characters they added, especially at the end.
7. The pacing was better in the earlier seasons. I felt I knew who was who, what they were doing, and it all mattered. This season it seemed like they kept our heads spinning with numerous characters and problems, most of which didn't make any sense at all. I also never understood why they were having the parties they were having at Downton. It just felt like a hodge-podge of characters and activities. Maybe I just didn't really pay attention.

THINGS I LIKED:
1. I think Lady Edith is my favorite character. First of all, she rolls with Mary's unmerited disdain for her rather graciously, she has significantly more depth than the other characters, and she FINALLY found love, though of course it was destined to fail anyway.
2. Isobel Crawley managed to add a dimension this season. I've been irritated by her in every season, up until Matthew died. It's good to see her humbled and be something other than holier-than-thou.
3. I found Bates forgiveness/understanding towards Anna after everything went down rather moving. Even though I hate what happened to Anna, I felt the writers dealt with the intra-marital processing of it rather well. It was probably the only moment in this season where I felt something.

Overall, I this this was an incredibly lackluster season that recycles what they've already done. Downton has lost its magic for me. I loved seasons 1-3, but something died in this one. It'll be interesting to see if they can recover it next season. I'm not getting my hopes up.

Downton Abbey is wonderful.  The story line is unique.  Cast of characters is varied.  Historical content and setting appear authentic.  I was hooked with watching Season 1. I have finished watching the first 3 seasons of Downton Abbey. I absolutely loved it. I couldn't help myself, I had to watch season 4 immediately or I was going to burst. But now I am angry I've wasted my money on renting the whole season 4. After avidly and happily watching the first 3 seasons, which brought this  show the deserved phenomenal global success, season 4 made me feel I've been cheated. From script, to story line, to character introduction and development it all falls flat. It's almost too  painful to watch. It feels like after being served a 12 course gourmet meal, made with the best ingredients one could find, now I have been force fed a hardship stew, even if it was served in a silver bowl. Either the writer cracked under the pressure or creative team got bullied by aliens, in any case, season 4 is a disaster for the Downton Abbey saga. I only hope that it can be brought back to the standards that made it a success. How very sad :-(

Well written, humorous, well acted with believable characters and surprising plot

Acting!! Production!!! Content!!! Historical Value!!! It is SOOOO worth the time to watch. I own it and will watch it all over again!

Having waited to watch Season 4 of Downton Abbey as it aired on PBS, and then going back to re-watch immediately after on blu-ray, I am struck by how much was in this season.  The costumes and acting and script is, of course, still brilliant and one of the best things on tv, IMHO.  Plus, how can you go wrong with the backdrop of Downton with its incredible rooms and the estate.  No matter that, this season, we spend some time in London, the estate and the house remain part and parcel of this show.

The stories both upstairs and downstairs still draw us in, as do the characters.  We love them.  We hate them.  There is romance and intrigue and discovery and wonder.  What more can you want in a drama?  In addition, the modern world keeps coming into Downtown--as we've moved from the introduction of the telephone and electrity in earlier seasons to sewing machines, mixers, and even talk of a refrigerator!  Its interesting to see what we take for granted these days as something strange and new and even a bit frightening.

Some spoilers below.

Very much, Season 4 is about love and loss.  Not just the obvious about Mary mourning the tragic loss of her husband, Matthew, as she lingers in the beginning between life and death.  But we all know her strength, even if she seems to have lost sight of it.  I also enjoyed the scene where the Dowager talked to Mary about making a choice over coming out of her loss, and also how she told off her son, Robert, when he would protect Mary from everything, even herself.  Its also good to see so many men chasing after Mary--she well deserves it!

Edith also faces love and loss and having to make a hard decision when it comes to her own love, Michael Gregson, and I've gone from disliking Edith as a character to feeling sorry for her and even admiring her for her own strength.  She's really come into her own in this season.  Her big choice, however, I suspect will come back to haunt her in Season 5 perhaps?

Branson is still also in mourning, not just for his wife but for his life.  He seems more unsure in this season, as if the fire had gone out of him.  Yes, he meets a new interest, but I'm still waiting for him to become the firebrand we knew from previous seasons...if only a bit more down to earth.  I really felt his story was one of the low points of the season, as I honestly don't care as much about him as I used to.  The other plot line I don't care for is Rose.  She just seems spoiled and annoying most of the time and we all know her romance with the bandsinger would come to nothing in the end.  I wish they would get Branson back to being himself again and figure out what to do with Rose besides trot her out to dance and play music and flirt all of the time.

Downstairs, there is the triangle of unrequited love with Daisy and Ivy and Alfred, which I thought they resolved in a very grown-up fashion.  There is also the question of what does Thomas hold over Cora's new maid?  Not to forget, the darkest plotline in this season--the brutal attack on Anna.  This was very hard to watch and really brought home some of the issues of being a woman in the 1920's.  When her husband finally found out and comforted her, it made me cry.  As for Mr Bates--did he or didn't he?  The Anna-Bates storyline remains one of the best in the show, shrouded as it is in hardship and pain over which the power of their love for each other wins through.

The final episode went from the palace to the seaside and, I must admit, watching our dour butler wading is well worth waiting a whole season for...

Overall, this is a great season and it remains a great show.  I can't wait for Season 5!
Entertaining and beautifully photographed. Decor and costumes are thrilling to the eyes. Fascinating nuances of class differences in England society and working class.
Not as gripping as last season although I do like the storyline with Edith!  Mary needs a more handsome mysterious suitor like Mr Pamook!

It is so interesting how we romanticize that era. Love the fashion and attention to every detail.

was an eye surgeon, Oxford University, Christ Church.

There is something about Downton Abbey that captivates fans. More than its authenticism, more than its characters or cast or even its plot twists, Downton is a voyeur's paradise, a glimpse into a world and an era, which--while for most is a distant echo--represents a time when our world retained a memory of innocence yet whispered of great evils on the horizon. No one should miss this series.

Every episode of the first 3 seasons were packed with exciting events, new characters, and scandals.  This one was just filled with everyday life. Started with Season 1 and got hooked. The actors are great and I love all the authentic costumes and scenery.
I miss Matthew.  Julian Fellows is out to make money.  He spread all his characters out and gives us a glimpse of their story.
This is a great show--well-written and beautiful to watch, as well as dramatic and funny.  I am totally hooked on this show.

The series is great however the DVD I received is defective and unfortunately there was no return slip or even a receipt at all in my package to return it.  It freezes on a number of the disks in the middle of the Episode.
Every minute is great acting and great story line to follow.  I watch each episode several times to catch all the meanings that follow through in story.
Wish it had the Christmas special. Good to see that they were able to pick up the plot and keep it fresh and new after Mathew died.
Every line is full of information. Carson does his character very well with looks of consternation, etc. Explains the Edith situation. The American v. Brit dynamic is excellent.
Excellent! Downton Abbey is one of the best tv shows with an all around talented cast! The British actors are really trained in art of acting to perfection!
The series continues to surprise and entertain despite the departure of some of the cast. A must see for fans of the show.
Its a shame I have to wait another year for the next installment of great shows.  I never get tired of the twists and turns, it never gets boring.

Unlike the other seasons of Downton Abbey, purchasing the season 4 DVD does NOT give you streaming access in your Amazon Video Library.  So to watch this online, you have to make a duplicate purchase.  Wish I knew this before I bought the DVD!

I can't get enough of Downton Abbey - love the story lines and character development in each season.  I love the costumes and clothing of the 1920's.  I only wish there were more episodes in each season, and we didn't have to wait so long between Seasn 4 & 5!  I will be happy to watch Season 4 again before season 5 airs.
This was a gift for my wife. See was overjoyed to receive it and I was pleased with the price.

I'm a huge fan of Downton Abbey and this season is no exception. Initially, I was really worried that this season would be a downer because of Mathew's death, but they dedicated little time to that. I really enjoyed Mary's return to the land of the living and I also liked Edith's story. Can't wait for Season 5.

I thoroughly enjoy Downton Abbey, but I missed it last week.  When I bought the episode and tried to watch it, it kept freezing the screen.  I don't know what was wrong, but it galls me that I had to pay for that.
Fantastic storyline- loved the last episode because it felt like a positive renewal of most of the characters that had been suffering for quite a while :)
The streaming was terrible, stopped every 2 - 3 minutes.  Not Downton, Amazon sucked.  I will never buy a video again.
This is the best of the Downton Abbey Seasons.  Acting is getting better and the plots are harder to figure out.

Many of us with an English background have parents who
worked " in service " which was worthy employment in those days.
The many exquisite  homes that resembled the castle, the Downton
in the series , were eventually taxed out of existence by post ww2
liberal governments. The series recreates the graceful manners of the period
and the beauty the occupants created in architecture, horticulture and the arts.
The interweaving of the lives and the house and the staff is entrancing.
The team  deserves the great army of followers they have gathered..
I and my spouse loved it and watched it got involved with it and so loved it that I just could not pass up the oportunity to be able to go back anytime a revisit this excellent  drama from Britain.

I am using a blu ray region A player and found that I had to switch the Motionflow setting on my Sony Bravia to 'Off' (!!) to stop horizontal motion flicker across the screen when people, vehicles and panning shots  are on screen. This does not  occur on other region  A discs I have.  My Blu ray player is switchable from Region B to A and I have not had this problem on Region B Downton Abbey discs...Stan Draper, Tasmania.
This story just keeps getting more and more interesting. The acting is just wonderful. Each character is just perfectly portrayed, Great job

This series is about how people cope with change. The fact that the people involved are landed nobility and their servants make it more interesting than, say, a series showing how lower-middle-class Americans are coping with declining real wages. Maybe we need THAT series too!
I look forward to the new season as they are released. These folks are doing a terrific with this difficult period piece!
I love this series. However, It left me flat.  I hope Edith finds her man. I hope Bates and Start a family.
I love the period, the characters, the storylines, the history, the costumes. I like everything about it.  (Sorry, I will NOT be forced to put a certain # of words in my reviews)
Like all of Downton Abbey, each turn is unexpected and each character is played and written to perfection, This is yet another example of how the BBC is so much better than american tv.

Why torture yourself waiting for the next week's installment?  For the last four season's I've purchased the dvd set.  When it arrives, I set down and begin watching, only rising when ALL the viewing is done.  I love spending the time with the Downton family; it is a delicious gift I give myself.

The season started slow but then became interesting.  I was probably one of the few who were not unhappy over Matthew demise at the end of last season,  I like my Mary interesting.  Edith who was always in background also became more interesting.  Bates has found an affinity with murder.  I just wish they would execute him quickly since his character has become tiresome.  I can't believe this season was so short!
We love Downton Abby and love being able to revisit it before each new season. We have all 4 seasons.
I really have enjoyed the series and was so happy that I could get the series on tape from Amazon at such a fantastic price.  I intend to buy the 5th series if it is offered at such a good price.
I got this on pre-order so I didn't have to wait week by week to watch this season.  I love the show!  Plus, I like to rewatch it in marathon form before each new season starts.
I absolutely love this show. The acting is superb and the story line never fails to entertain. I cant wait for season five!
So enjoy Dawnton Abbey.  The acting, storyline, and directing is outstanding. Does show how upstairs and downstairs interact.....A must see.

Just had to have it before the series concluded on my local PBS station!  The story continues to be well-written, well-acted, and entertaining.  I love the attention to detail and the character development.  Now, if only Season 5 were ready for release . . .
I can't stop watching this show, its very addicting. Make sure you have lots of time because you will want to watch more thsn 1 at a time.
Have watched all of the Downton Abby series.  Love the series and can not wait for season five to come out.

I believe this is the finest series the Masterpiece Theatre has produced, no exception!  My wife and I have watched this over and over again.  The acting, plot and character development, so missing in most of Hollywood productions, is simply outstanding.  I would rate it 10 stars!
This show is enthralling and easy to watch. Season four was short and over too quickly, but the quality is superb. It is a must watch.
Not as exciting as season three but still a quality show. I am always looking forward to see what will happen next. Bravo!!

I CAN'T GET ENOUGH OF DOWNTON ABBEY!!!!  WHEN WILL SEASON 5 BE AVAILABLE.  PLEASE LET ME KNOW.

THANKS,

BEVERLY TEWELL
Very high quality show and developed new story lines and characters but was way too short and needed more episodes.
I love the show, and the season 4 DVE is excellent.  It provides great background info also, and is user friendly.

Characters are even more developed than in previous seasons.  This is addicting. Maggie Smith is absolutely wonderful. The interaction between the "older generation" is one of the most fascinating parts of this absolutely marvelous season.

Very well done.  Characters come alive to give a window into life in England between the world wars and after--and into the massive and relatively abrupt socio/economic/cultural changes which transformed a way of life.
Would like to write one, we supposedly were sent an A1 UK version, to only have a blank by three different machines.

I have purchased all episodes and watched at least 20 times.  It is the finest of all.  The mind could not be idle because the script kept the watchers attention at all times.  Never a dull moment in the whole of it.  I am very anxious for  season 5
This season is just  too short !  Love this series...the sorties, setting and what history it portrays.  Will watch it over and over.
Got it when promised and in good condition.  Enjoyed it very much. Good quality as usual. Ready for the next season!
This series is very entertaining, holds your interest, is very well acted, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Can't wait for season 5.  Enjoy!

It is such a pleasure to watch "reality" without it being bloody, noisy, sexiest, people screaming at each other - a true gem of entertainment.  So many of us are under stress of some form, Downton Abby takes you away from everyday, sometimes mundane situations for at least an hour.  The only negative is waiting for the next episode.
Amazing cast,  amazing plot, and amazing scenery. I loved watching each plot line unfold with such authenticity to the time.

It took me 7 days but I finally finished watching all the episodes, season 1 through season 4.  The characters are well developed, the scenery is sumptuous and the plot is engulfing.  I can't wait for season 5.

I can't really justify my addiction to this drama about spoiled rich Brits, and Mary is already beginning to wear a bit thin, though I admire the poise and confidence of her character. The acting is excellent, the clothes are beautiful, the interiors are ravishing, the accents of the servants are melodic, and Season 4 continued to hold my interest. I'll be waiting for the next season.
My husband and I loved every part of the series.  This last year is no exception.  The characters never disappoint us.
This series is good, clean television.  Well written and well presented.  I look forward to each season. Thank you fro offering it to us.

Love this series! The simplicity of a story woven into interesting characters through history. I ordered first 4 seasons on Amazon and looked forward to watching each day. I was recovering from an operation and this was a great series to comfort me! Can not wait for season #5!!

I love, love, love Downton Abbey I have all four seasons Just wish season five was not so far off!!!!
Really get involved with the characters. Some of the things that happen to some of the main characters
was infuriating BUT the way the writers blended the endings was GREAT>

I would tell the whole world to watch all 4seasons of this.  It is incredible.  From the wardrobes to the characters there is so much to enjoy.  I think the very uniqueness of each character is the highlight of the series.  Also the servant/family relationships  are extraordinary.  So well written !
Mary
I love this program!  This DVD did not disappoint; it was flawless in quality and I will be able to venture to the Abbey whenever I like.  It doesn't get any better than this.

What can be said of Downton?  The stories are compelling, the characters continue to grow and reveal their strengths and weaknesses.  Lady Rose is a nuisance but Mrs. Crawley is the star of this whole season.  Her humanity and love for all her neighbors is sterling silver. Violet continues to be the spice of DA but even now has a more loving and humane character than she displayed in the previous seasons.  Mrs. Hughes may be the finest example of highest womanhood and courage.  If there is no fifth season, I am willing to be content; if there is there are so many loose ends to be tied up!  DA is the finest drama series in the history of television!

I am so hooked on this program.  I haven't seen it before but have heard of it.  I watched all 4 seasons just to see what this show was all about and I can hardly wait to see the next season.  I like having all the seasons available to me so I can re-watch them over and over till I figure who is who and what the show is all about.
It was an awesome series, I receoved it in a very timely manner.. I purchased the previous 3 seasons and was very pleased.

The purchase of Downton Abbey Season 4 was great and was everything I had expected it to be.
The DVD arrived very quickly and in good order.
The writers and actors continue with another season of excellent drama and period story telling.  Thank you for keeping the story going - well done.

FINALE is Awesome! You must see this if you have not already!
The story line is great and the outcome is satisfying!
Its a great series especially if you are interested in a historically accurate period piece.  Interesting and complex characters as well.
Another great season of the night time soap opera.  I am addicted so I can't say anything bad about it, except that it takes so long for the next season to begin.
Is that the end for another season?  Hmmm, I love the show. Have watch from episode one, but the last show sure didn't feel like a season finale

After the first three seasons, where we learned that having a child will destroy your life - there aren't too many people to bump off.  The story lines are not the best, and hopefully in next season the remaining characters will find their balance without the folks who were all killed off previously.  My biggest criticism is: Why is Lady Cora a complete idiot about the staff, and at some point Thomas just needs to go to America and stay there - he's useless as a foil and pointlessly creepy.
I wondered where they would go and I was impressed they did more then I expected, this season.  I won't wonder about season five.

I have all 4 seasons now and have enjoyed them all.  The costumes have always been beautiful but this year they were outstanding

I love Maggie Smith.  Only Lady Violet can get away with what she says.  She is outrageous and wonderful.
This DVD will only work on my computer and not in the DVD player!! It's one day to late to return it. Very frustrating!!!
This was not Downton's finest hour, but it got better as the year went on, and finished with an absolute gem.
I adore the show as much for the fantastic Maggie Smith as for anything else. It's gotten a tad soapish, but I can't quit!

It has plot, subplots, suspense, historic interest and a fair smattering of humor. Conflicts develop at interpersonal levels and at class levels as well.

This is a very watchable story of struggle with societal change (a very modern theme) kept alive with lively action and good humor.

Highly recommended.

John A. Leraas
Fantastic sorry we must wait another year before the next one is here in Canada. I hope they bring more Christmas specials out.
Entertaining for our entire family ages 18 to 65! Looking  forward to the next season, though sure wish there were more episodes each season.

Wonderful program for the season #4.  Our friends here in Algodones, Baja, Mexico, all have enjoyed the programs as I share them with each family.  The stories just keep coming to us in the world of Downton Abbey.  Thank you very much.

I am a big big fan of Downton Abbey and at the end of each season I can't wait for the next one to start. As with all the other ones it leaves me wanting more. I just love the evolution of the characters, relationships, costumes, etc.

I enjoyed this whole series immensely. The characters are interesting, funny at times, and the interaction between them is great, just like watching a virtual reality; the acting is outstanding and I love their British snobbery.
Maggie Smith is still a great actress, my daughter in law says I remind her of her. Don't know whether that is a compliment or not but they also enjoyed the series. I was sorry it came to an end, I was ready for the results of the child coming to live there under cover, the romances of Mary and the on going back and forth between the others. It was so well acted, kudos to all.

I have never in my tv/series view history enjoyed a more show than Downton Abbey.  Delightful, suspenseful, emotional, and humorous.  No single show or season has been a disappointment and am looking forward to season five.  Not only looking forward to upcoming season but would have no trouble watching the previous seasons repeatedly as well.
Love it just sorry I have to wait another year love Anna and bated oh yes the grandmother love her
I love the complexity of relationships and the challenges of the period's culture. So different from my life. It is a trip into a romanticized era.

I can't say enough good things about this show.  The characters are fascinating and the plots are so good, I can't wait for Sunday Nights.  Even my husband can't wait.  He normally doesn't like much on TV.  My only criticism is the season is too short.  This season just started in January and already the last of Feb, they had the finale.  I don't understand that.  Please, let it be a longer season!

This is the type of  thing where the British excel.  Great story, great scenery, attention to detail and left with an open ending for another season, I hope.  The one problem I encountered was technical.  The second disc was not formatted to play in my dvd  player but played just fine in my computer.  Again, a great story. Well told.  Well filmed.

This season was just as good as the others! It continues on with the story lines set from the first 3 seasons, as well opens more into the lives of other characters. It provides all the emotions one would look for while also including a historically rich show. Love the clothes and accents. Always keeps my attention and wanting more!

Acting, sets, period costumes and vehicles, all near-perfect. Maggie Smith steals every scene she's in! At times a bit like a daytime soaper, but everything works to make it so far superior to commercial offerings they pale by comparison. Speaking of "commercial TV"  there aren't any. Commercials, that is.
I love the whole series and am glad to own this 4th season as well. I look forward to next year!

I'm looking forward to Season 5.  Great casting.
I can't imagine anyone else playing Carson, Mary, Thomas, Daisy, Mosely, etc.
One of the best miniseries I've ever watched! Absolutely absorbing. The characters are terrific, I recommend it to everyone. I can't wait for the new season.

The fourth season was very very good but it ends too early.  Need more episodes, please.  I like the addition of the uncle from America and Shirley  looks too frumpy.  She's a beautiful woman, let her shine!
Great acting wonderful writing! I laugh and cry almost every episode! A classic show that makes me feel. Great !

Wish there was more, we always binge view & then regret it when we're done. We have to wait soooooo long for the next season.  Matthew's death was a great loss, hopefully Mary's three new suitors will find their stride & one will come to the forefront as an audience grabber like Matthew was.

From someone not really fond of British anything, this turned out to be the best entertainment ever. I couldn't wait for the next episode.  The viewer is treated with excellence from every aspect. (Best writing, directing, acting, character development, costumes, sets, cinematography and more).  Life lessons from this show will be shared wth my children for as long as I am a parent.

Season four was breathtakingly beautiful and action packed!  After the death of Matthew Crawley I was skeptical about how they were going to flesh out Mary Crawley's character, but Julian Fellowes prevails, and gives Mary and the viewer many suitors to choose from.  Always a joy to watch, even poor Edith's story line will keep you intrigued!  A must see show for anyone who loves romance, history, and British hierarchy!!!!

Downton Abbey continues with enough mystery to hold your attention and enough romance to satisfy the most ardent romantic viewer. I do wish that they would give more attention to the political back story, the coming of socialism to England.
Local pbs station only delivers in low-res, so buying the HD version from Amazon delivered the full majesty of this great show.
This is beautifully done.  We watch it over and over and have shared it with many friends.  Great investment.  :-)

We don't watch a lot of T.V. so we are picky on what we watch. We really enjoyed Season 4. The storyline on Downton Abbey is very well done and the acting is superb in my opinion. It is not your normal run of the mill T.V. show.
Julian Fellows seems to be tired of writing this soap opera.  The series is not the quality of the first three seasons.

The season was quickly over. Now we must wait until next year? for season 5? Not well timed. The acting is always good. Maggie Smith is a trip! The children are not often shown. We do not have a sense of their personalities or integration into the family life.  The societal idea that the old traditions have to change is interesting. I liked the part with Mary and the pigs!  Of course we knew what would happen with Bates and the molester. I like the relationship with Mosley and Cora's lady. So there ya go! Wait....wait....
I prefer Doc Martin.
Very enjoyable show..music, scenery, well-paced drama with great story line...we enjoy virtually the entire cast...we look forward to the next season..

We have thoroughly enjoyed the Downtown Abbey series, and we were not disappointed with the final episode.  This classic is certainly one of the top three in our all time favorites, and we will be viewing it over and over again in the future.  We look forward to the next season.
I couldn't wait to see how the season ended and now I cannot wait for Season 5.  So glad Amazon has this prior to the end of the television viewing season.
Love love love!!!!!  Such a great series!!! Wish that there were more episodes but that's ok. Can't wait to see what happens next.
I started watching this with a lot of reservations. Once I watched the first couple of shows, I was hooked.
Love the fashions and the beautiful setting.  Great actors and script, very entertaining, especially Maggie Smith.  She gets the best lines.
best ever series I loved it!  Cannot wait for the next season. I love all the characters and the story line

Very informative of the 1920's, and historically accurate. Shows a nice development of relations and attitudes between  America and Britain. Very interesting way to watch the evolving attitudes and cultures so often just taken for granted. Can't wait for season 5 to begin.
I'm a big fan of Downton Abbey and unfortunately was unable to view it on TV so I immediately ordered it thereby solving the problem!!  Can't wait for Season 5!
If you have the first three seasons, you must have this one. Wonderful costume designs and story line, can hardly wait for season 5.

I enjoy the movie. There are twist and turn in the plot that you want to see more about it. Due to the individual stories from the masters to the helpers it makes more interesting. I wonder when Season 5 will be coming, I am looking forward to see it.
Rick
What can I say . . . The story, the characters, the people that bring it life . . . excellent programming!  The costuming . . . simply exquisite!
It is a mystery and yet a story about people who care for each other no matter whatever their status in life is.

Hello, I am so looking forward to the fifth season.  The acting is outstanding and the setting is perfect!

I borrowed the large book, the hard back. I want my own book.  Please advertise this, along w the cd, etc. membership in ETV needs to be more visible.  We will pay for decent tv.  Great tv.  Thanks for offering this wonderful show.  We feel we are right there!
This is such a joy to watch. I love the costumes and the castle. The cast is great, except Borrows.

I gave it four stars over 5, because after the loss of Mary's husband, to me nothing will ever be a 5.  The show is spectacularly made and acted.  They take you from 2014 and travel you back to the 1920's.  I have all the seasons and watch them with such enjoyment. I Love Downton!!!!
Not as good as other seasons, but still really fun. If you've watched the first three seasons, why stop now ?

The series was wonderful and the season finale was the best finale i've seen in years for any show. It was nice to say "farewell" until next time to a show with all the characters in a hopeful place instead of hanging by a thread for their lives. It's weary-ing to always have shows end with the viewer left in suspense. I don't like being suspended all the time.
I started watch this from the first and love it cant wait to see what going to happen please hurry
I absolutely love this show. So many twist and turns! Its so cool to see how things were done back then.
I love the characters, the plot twists, the costumes, the history and the beautiful settings.  i can't wait for Season 5!

Despite George Will's idiotic, overwrought and just plain unnecessary column attempting read some political message into this series, the writing, to this point, and Season 4 in particular, is enormously entertaining.  Let's hope that George becomes so discomfited by the socialist leanings of the series that he decides to focus his future overstated columns extolling the virtue of Duck Dynasty as a subtle celebration of anti-intellectualism.

 Great story and wonderful acting.
Arrived quickly, and a great movie to escape to another era in time. I highly recommend taking a weekend to relax and enjoy it.

i gave the first three series as a birthday gift to my friend who just got into watching this show starting with series 4...so I thought she needed the first three series and she can hardly wait to begin from the beginning.  great service....thank you
Downtown Abbey will always get 5 stars in my book!  One of the best shows I've watched in a long time.

I was a big Downton Abbey hater until I actually watched the show...I love this show. This was great pick me up from season three.  The Mathew story is resolved and a whole new host of plots happen to our beloved characters.  I had a great time watching this season, it went by so fast!  Spoiler below----------------------
Mr. Carson and Mrs. Hughes holding hands and walking into the ocean together was such a great moment and one that I had been waiting for since season 1.
Excellent series. Makes you feel like you are living in that time period and that the characters are real persons. .
Costumes, settings, plot twists and turns.  Characters keep you engaged.  Fascinating to watch life change as after World War I

All of the Downton Abbey Series were excellent!  We want more!

Will we get some more fine acting of the Aristocracy in England in "days of old?"
Amazing show! Cannot wait until the next season starts. I am addicted to all of the changes and multiple characters.
An excellent continuation of the series and the DVD was shipped to me in two days, a requirement as I was taking it to Australia to enjoy with family.
Great actimg  costumes people are absolutely..the turns taken keep o intriuging as difficilto what she will drop..reallly great story.  Marvelous!!!
I absolutely am captivated by Downton Abbey and so enjoy being able to watch this whenever I like on my Kindle. It's always a long wait between seasons but these episodes make the time go by easier.

Beautiful, delightful, sad, happy, aren't the kids cute, Maggie Smith is superb, please do not ever end this show!  Another great
year.  It's nice to see more characters developing stories of their own.  The costumes are gorgeous.  The scenes are stunning.
If you are new to Downton Abbey, start from the beginning.  You will want to watch over and over again.
After watching the first 3 seasons I knew I couldn't wait to watch the 4th season. I've only watch the first half of the season but I can't wait to finish watching the rest of the season.

Love Downton Abbey!! I bought all the other seasons in the past and had to keep the collection going. Besides I work on Sunday nights when it comes on PBS, so I needed a way to keep up with the goings on before my co-workers blabbed about what happened!
Don't buy UK DVD's if you live in Australia!! The dvd is coded to the country you purchase from and I did not realise. Wasted money!
Althoug I only watched the first show of the 4th. season because I watch the series on PBSI throughly enjoy the series and cant wait to see the show every week.

The cast is superb, the setting wonderful, and the story line interesting.
The time period, just prior to the second World War gives me a feeling of
what life was all about in England in the late 1920"s.
The only down side of Season 4 is it isn't long enough!  Not quite as engaging as season 3, but Masterpiece does a masterful job with most of their productions.  Hope there will be many more seasons!
I love "DowntonAbbey and this one is just as good as the others. I picked 5 stars as it is certainly worth that.
This season was pretty deep.  Highs and lows for everyone and dealt with a horrific act in such a way as to make it a lesson for all.

Anytime you feel that you cannot wait for the next episode to broadcast, it usually means that show is very good.  That's how I felt from the first episode to the last week episode of Downton Abbey.  The storyline is great, the acting is great even the costumes are excellent.  Downton Abbey is one of my favorites, and I'm one that watches a lot of television but am very particular about what I watch.
Honestly, I couldn't wait to get season 4. Season 3 left me in a state of needing to know what happens next. Season 4 is terrific and I enjoyed every minute if it.
Love the series, love the DVD with its special behind-the-scenes features. Seeing the cast as their real-world selves is nice.

I found it so good that it was hard to put it away after viewing the first disc.  I finished it in three nights, and I think I love watching series this way best of all.  When season 5 comes out, let me know as I am in.
Downton Abbey is a superbly written series with grace, charm and lots of witty characters.  Just keeps getting better and better

Might I suggest that the whole family--w. key servants aboard, of course--take an extended holiday to visit relatives in Prohibition America.  That would provide plenty of plot grist for the Season 5 episode mill!
My mother and I just did a 4 season Downton Abbey Marathon....love, love, love it!!!! Can't wait to see more unfold!
Catching up after missing a few episodes and being glad I can see it all in a sweep without waiting for a week to go by.
This season has moved along at a quick pace.  Glad that no major character had to die (move on to new roles) this year.
Enjoyed seeing how both sides lived together and how they functioned together. Great cast, very real situations and suprising outcome at times .
Wonderful story line. Acting is excellent. Sets and scenery well done . Hugh bonneville great lord grantham is wonderful. Easy to watch.
I love this series. I watched it on Amazon from the very beginning.. I missed it for the first 4 seasons on PBS station listed as Masterpiece Collections.. You won't be sorry if you start watching..
Quick arrival just in time for a winter snow storm and a marathon viewing!  Looks very good in blue ray.
I am hooked, just wish it was weekly instead of seasonal. The characters are perfect, the costumes are to die for.
Excellent series. Can't wait for another season. I hope there will be one. Loved the costumes and sets as well.

I've been captivated with the Downton Abbey series since it first began. The story is superb the actors superb and the whole story line is just great. The finale of season four was especially good. I have really enjoyed the show and can't wait until season five.
EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT - CHARACTERS JUST GET MORE AND MORE INTERESTING.  TWISTS AND TURNS.  I WISH THAT MARY WOULD CHOOSE A SUITOR.

love the love interest for lady mary, the entanglement of lady edith, and, of course, the clothes!
and then the romance between mrs. hughes and mr. carson.
Season two seems a bit contrived at times, a bit of a desperate move to keep the story addictive.  And I am, I confess!  Can't wait for Season 5!

What is there NOT to like about the tales of  a great english house and the Family therin.
The open stories of the "Family " of the House  and then the corresponding stories  featuring members of the
household staff. These stories about a much more polite and  hardworking society  are an example to us
compared to the incessant rudeness and sarcasm that is the core of most modern day "soaps"
Bring it on. I much prefer this type of dramatisation to the garbage that makes up most of our regular channels..

I was pleased to see some of the writing that was so that had me hooked in seasons 2 and 3 towards the end of season 4. To be honest some of the writing in the first half of season 4 was a let down. It didn't have the zest, intrigue or  the sassy dialogue that was seasons 2 and 3 had so richly intertwined throughout those seasons.
It seems that Edith, Rose and Tom Branson (Sybil's widowed husband) will continue to have a tendency to keep getting into trouble.
It will also be interesting to see how things develop with Mary and her current two suitors. Each one of the suitors has their own merits.
I was very disappointed in the casting of Cora's brother when they went with Paul Giamatti. I have seen him portray a villain very well but he was a poor choice for the role of someone who is supposed to be a well known playboy. The character was also poorly written because he had no social graces at all. They could have made a much better choice for this role in terms of writing and casting.
I enjoyed the little storyline for Daisy and the possibility of romance for Mr Carson.
Episode 9 has me anxious to see the new developments for the upcoming season 5. It's a shame that it will take nearly another year before we can see it in the United States. (sigh)

Captivating stories about a bygone lifestyle and the people who lived it.  Each episode is beautifully filmed...the costumes and ambiance are exquisite.  The acting is superb,  as I always believe the character to be a real person, rather than an actor playing a role in the drama. I wait until a whole season is finished before I purchase  Downton Abbey so I can watch each episode without a week's wait between.  I buy the whole season at once and then I binge Watch Downton Abbey on a weekend.
They have done much better, and they will in the future. The last episode was hopeful. I look forward to next season.

This show is consistently well written, directed and acted. Plots are well thought out and there is a good level of consistency and carry through from one episode to the next no matter what time span has elapsed between episodes in the story. Most portent though, these are appealing complex characters who show growth and humanity in great measure. The show is rich and satisfying.

I'm glad I can get Downton Abbey from Amazon.  I have a lot of trouble understanding the British accent, partially because of the over all volume being low and hard to hear.  Being able to have the subtitles that are possible from Amazon clarifies the program immensely.  It's amazing what I miss when I watch it without the captions and then watch it with them.  The character relationships are difficult to follow and being able to read the names helps.  Overall, I find that the program draws me in and keeps me rivited.  I'm sorry the season is so short.
Need I say more about the  great program on PBS? One of their best programs in recent years and a series that has usually none television watchers, watching television.

Gosh I love this show!  It has many historical inaccuracies (such as the family treating the servants like close relatives) but to me that's what makes this show so wonderful.  The writers are able to merge the upstairs and the downstairs which gives the show a feeling of cohesiveness.  It's as if we're watching a show about a small town rather than a large house.  Barrow's humility at being allowed to return to Downton Abbey & even given a much better post is all gone and he is back to his nefarious ways. Mary is coming out of her extended period of mourning & beginning to realize that she is a hot commodity.  Bates & Anna are caught up in a web of lies & deceit that just may break them apart...and could end up with someone being hanged.  Cousin Rose is at her rebellious best.....Not the cliffhanger this season that we had in previous seasons, but all in all a stellar season - as usual.

Initially, I thought this program looked incredibly boring until one night my husband and I decided to give it our "ten minute test," (we watch a movie or television show for about ten minutes and if we aren't hooked, we don't waste any more time with it). Not only were we caught up in the stories, but had to watch one program after another, averaging about three every night until we got completely caught up.  The acting is superb, the directing, writing, historical research is all, as they say, "spot on." This show is ANYthing but boring!
We feel as if we've been swept up into a different time period--a little like taking a vacation...I'm not kidding.  Here we were learning all sorts of marvelous, historical things and had only set out to be entertained.
The only drawback I could possibly imagine is that two of the "villains" seemed to simply be vicious, evil people and one dimensional for a while there, but then most people who behave badly don't often appear to be more on the outside, either.
Watching Downton Abbey truly is like walking in to a time machine--but be forewarned, if you watch the first show you'll want to see all the rest!

My lovely daughter-in-law gave me Masterpiece: Downton Abbey Seasons 1, 2 & 3 Deluxe Limited Edition (Amazon Exclusive Season 4 Bonus Features) for Christmas 2013. I wasn't quite sure I was going to like the show, even after hearing all the hype about it. So I decided to watch the first couple of shows so I could at least say I made the effort and thus fell in love with the show. So I raced through watching seasons 1-3 and luckily season 4 was out by then. Some of the newness has worn off but this is still quite a show. Stellar performances (I especially like Maggie Smith); fantastic settings; beautiful costumes - this is quite a quality production. I know there's been a lot of negatively surrounding season 4 of Downton, but if you're a fan, don't give up. Of course we miss Sybil and Matthew, but since the actors chose to leave, there's nothing to be done about it. I believe that the writers did a great job considering that they had to rewrite characters' lives. I do like the addition of what Violet calls "Mary's men." Sure, it's a little distasteful that she has three men hanging from the fishing line, but instead of thinking of it that way, enjoy them. The actors do a wonderful job, they're all so handsome, and their characters really do add a nice element to the story (even though we still miss Matthew). My main complaint is what they're doing with Tom Branson (Sybil's husband). Sure, he still misses his wife, and he's lonely, but do they really have to pair up such a great guy with those horrid women. Please, please say that Miss Bunting won't return because I can't stand her character. Rose's childish antics can't compare with Sybil's free spirit, but I'm glad they made her a bit different rather than trying to "create" another personality like Sybil's. She brings a little spunk to the show. Mary is the "cold fish," but she's still one of my favorites, and has some great one-liners. Not as great as Violets, but still worth a laugh.

Anyway, rant over. I really do adore this show, and I look forward to season 5. All in all, I believe they're doing a great job considering all the changes.

Season 3 solidified the Snob Hill Gang in quick drying cement then ended...4 brought in enough real people to keep the cement from stiffening our arteries...We LOVE the family but we're now finding opportunities to like n respect them as they grow from insufferable to victims of a dying breed. The 2nd layer of folks and their strength of character is humanizing the upstairs family and empowering the downstairs family to dream and upgrade their thinking and mobility.

Season four is jumpy, characters are hollow and undeveloped.  How many times do we have to hear Barrows ask the new maid Miss Baxter if she has  heard any stories?  How many times do we have to watch Lady Mary reject suitors?  And this whole thing with Edith's beau has been dragged out and gone nowhere fast.  In short, we were hugely disappointed with season 4.  It was far too disjointed, too many "cuts," too little real story line development.  Hope it improves next season.

This is one of the best shows I've ever seen, best plots, best acting, best costumes and scenery, really the whole thing is magical and romantic beyond words.  But.  This season had a brutal and very real rape scene in episode 2.  If I wanted stuff like that, I could always listen to rap music or watch crime dramas.  Matthew's death didn't bother me, Sybil's death, the episode with the Persian diplomat, all were handled realistically but were not horrible in any way.  I watch this show for the loveliness of it, not to be jarred by gritty and ugly "real life".  The writers made a terrible mistake, and I found it traumatic enough to give up on the show for the rest of the season.  So bear in mind when reading this review, it's only for 2 episodes.  I highly recommend the first 3 seasons of Downton, without reservations, but not this one.  Such a shame, it used to be so very, very good.

Sadly they didn't give shirley maclaine much to do but be snarky and wear pretty dresses. Paul Giamatti was a real treat and played the role nothing like I thought he'd be. I got hooked on the show with season 1.  But if the show had been like it was this season I doubt if I would have watched more than a couple of episodes. Don't read further if you haven't seen the season and don't want to know what happens. First of all, each episode jumps from one scene to another, often within just a matter of a minute or less. Perhaps that's good for a video game, but not for a drama.  Second, some of story lines have become tedious.  We get it, Lady Mary is hot, but to have not one, but two guys after her is not all that interesting, episode after episode. Besides the guys are too similar and actually look too much alike to make me care who actually "wins Mary."  Also what was once a delightful relationship between Anna and once charming Bates is now  fraught with Anna's rape and possibly a murder by Bates. Whatever it is that Thomas has over the new lady's maid has also gone on far to long without revealing what it is and the love triangle in the kitchen at most should have been resolved after a few episodes, not for several shows over two seasons.  Finally too much time was given to things like the coming out party of Rose with just a blink about what happened when Edith gave birth to a baby.  Other things are almost ignored also like the two children, who we see maybe twice in the entire season. I will probably continue to watch season 5 because I am curious about what happens, but I also imagine that the show will continue to go downhill until it finally mercifully ends.

...the season doesn't have enough episodes!  Let's get a lot of Maggie Smith videoed because at the rate these seasons come out she'll have to live to be 200 to get this story told.

I didn't think this season progressed the story very much but, wow, each episode flew by when I was watching it so I guess it was pretty darn good anyway.

The sets are great.  Some of the acting is good.  The depiction of many aristocrats is believable in that they exhibit their naive ignorance of "real life".  Is this supposed to be a sociological look at the difference of classes, acceptance of people in an era when there was little acceptance of outsiders?  Is it supposed to be a fairy tale world of people getting along across the barriers of the crippling conventions of the British Empire?  Is it supposed to imply that the favored rich of that world have big hearts and are just ordinary folk who can accept the chauffeur with no demur?  To show how the Americans appeared to underwrite many of the great houses of Britain but were generally still looked down upon for their differences?  Anthony Trollope may have been able to do justice to this group of people, but I think the story as it is goes nowhere.

With all real soap operas too many characters get into the stew as they are introduced to keep the story going,  and then there isn't time to develop anything very deeply.  Too many cameo parts, and no cohesive story.  The last episode was the worst of all, leaving everything up in the air with no resolutions.  Julian Fellowes just seems unable to let go of all this panorama of people moving around, dancing, being presented at court and almost always punctuated by that MUSIC.  Who wrote that theme song?

We are subjected to that putrid music constantly as well as all these unlikely relationships.  Granted there are some stand-out characters such as Maggie Smith and some of the other women, but compare it to the old Upstairs Downstairs where every episode really had some sort of genuine social or political issue and the class thing was so much more in the open?  Or Brideshead Revisited for its ambience.  Both of those works had a beginning middle and end and both of them were well written.

I vote no on Downton Abbey.  I really hoped it would improve, that there would be some actual depth in the story, that something would happen--- but it just floated out on that never ending theme song of sawing violins.
Bought this DVD months ago and watched it. Realized tonight the finale is playing on TV and this episode was not included in the DVD I received!  Very disappointing!
My wife and I love watching this show together.  I have only watched the first episode, but I really like it.
I am unable to play this Blu ray DVD as it is a region A DVD and I did not know this at time of purchase - so I am not happy

Great cast, great story line, excellent characters generally following the arc of history.  I got this set to be able to do the entire season over a single weekend and relish repeating favorite scenes.  As some one who is widely read in history and history of England between the wars, I was interested to see how they adapted to rapidly changing social climate and it was great to have a new character talking about the decline of landed and titled estates.  I could hope that the series goes up through 1939 like the second edition of Upstairs/Downstairs which I finished watching recently.  The general strike, the depression and rise of Fascism in the '20's and '30's would be fascinating, particularly to see how the family reacts to the political contrasts between Chamberlin and appeasement and Churchill and war preparedness.
The cast ,settings and production are superb, the attitudes and manners reflect the period although sometimes jarring with present day outlooks.

The season began with a slow start.  However, with the tragic ending of season 3 and Matthew's death, this was probably expected and my curiosity was peaked.  We have not watched the final episode of season 4 but the writer has taken the viewer into several different directions with various characters.  What will happen to Edith and her decision about her baby.  Where will Rose's  mischievous behavior take her, will Mr. Bates be in trouble with the law again, will Mary and Tom save Downton Abbey from financial ruin, what will Mary decide about her two suitors, and will Tom make a political stand.  The Dowager and Matthew's mother are always interesting.  Season 4 makes me eager to continue the saga.  I'm enthralled with the story, characters, setting, and period of time in which the story takes place.
Love it! The characters, fashion, Maggie Smith!!!  Can't wait to see how she and Shirley MacLaine handle their upcoming encounter.
I love historical fiction and this is a TV version at its best.  The characters, location, scenery, historical significance, drama, costumes everything is perfect.
Writers continue to evolve the characters against the backdrop of historic change and challenges in rural England of the 1920's.

My daughter and daughter-in-law had been raving about this series, so I decided I would start watching the series through Amazon.  Between Thanksgiving and Christmas - actually right up to the time when Season 4 began, I watched all of the episodes for all of the seasons.  I just couldn't stop watching them.  I find the characters in the series to be very interesting, and the writers really make them believable.  I'm happy to see there are also villains and that everything isn't just "coming up roses".  I've cried when a main character dies (and even got mad that they were written out of the cast but also realize there must have been other opportunities they wanted to pursue. There has been a lot written already, observing that this 4th Season of Downton Abbey is not up to snuff with previous Seasons.  Some viewers may see it that way and that is their right.  All of life changes, evolves and goes through ups and downs.  Life is a roller-coaster ride  -- ever more-so in the 21st Century.  It is the rare enterprise that can sustain a steady, constant ever upward trajectory.  The characters and the crew of Downton are the same stuff of humanity as the rest of us.  If Season 4 may lack the usual gravitas of what we have to appreciate on Masterpiece Theatre, that may be expected and may not come as a surprise.  It must be said that the novelty of Downton, after three (3) Seasons, may have worn off, and viewers have settled in, and it may be more difficult to surprise us.  Life has a way of being life: there are bills, there are struggles to keep and maintain our homes, there is ill-health and death, there are animals that must be cared for.  And there is the ever-present and continuing human drama, comedy, melodrama, and tumult of all of our lives be we aristocracy or servants or regular white and gray and blue-collar average everyday citizens.  There is a slightly different tone to Season 4, but life, whether fictional or real moves on.  None of us in our best days can maintain the quality of life to which we aspire.  Downton and most of British television, film, theatre, music -- the general cultural array -- still outshines American production and production values year in and year out.  America's cultural contributions to the world are now submitted by addled sophomoric fraternity boys and sorority girls.  As the latest report on American ex-patriots indicates, more and more Americans are looking for the exits.

Don't you hate those people, who rush to see the premier of movies, or buy the first-edition of best-selling books, and then are compelled to tell everyone about the plot or the ending?  Me too, but unfortunately I married one of them.

My wife coerced me (she has truly compelling forms of pressure) to purchase the Season 4 DVD of Downton Abbey as soon as it became available.  It arrived about mid-way during the weekly TV presentations.  She had worked herself up to a fever pitch over Mr. Green's sordid assault, and was, by sheer will power, bent on compelling Mr. Bates's revenge.  We had to immediately watch all of the remaining episodes the day the DVD came, and she was temporarily sated.  However, for the next few weeks, at her office, at parties, at stores, over the fence to neighbors, she was enthusiastically ruining the series for everyone interested by divulging all the important events.  She's a sick woman, but I didn't know that when I proposed.

BTW, the series is great - Maggie S. is as wonderfully acerbic and caustic as is Englishly possible.  And, for once, the series ends on a happy note.  Disregard that last sentence If you haven't seen the last episode yet.  I'm not like my wife.
