I am a loyal Downton Abbey fan, and this season had me on the edge of my seat plenty of times.  Overall, it seemed a little "darker" than previous seasons.  I would still highly recommend it.

I am currently watching Season 4 of "Downton Abbey" as it's being aired on PBS, and I believe that Julian Fellowes has brought the story further into the 1920's in a thoughtful and dramatically compelling manner.  Last season he had to cope with two of his stars leaving, Dan Stevens' departure being a huge challenge to the series.  His decision to begin Season 4 six months past Matthew's death was a wise one.  There are some very dark, gritty moments this season, but there are some delightful, lighter moments as well.

Last night I watched episode 5 when it aired, and later in the evening decided to watch it again with less household interruptions on my new DVD set.  I was very surprised to find that lines had been cut; specifically some belonging to Mrs. Patmore and Lady Rose.  A friend has since told me that there are others.

This makes me wonder how much editing has occurred with the other other episodes, and in the DVD sets of seasons past.  I can't believe that Julian Fellowes would be pleased that his dialogue is being pruned, for whatever reason.

The packaging assures that it's the "Original UK Edition", and in fact it is not even the series as it's being shown in the US.

Well to start I'm a BBC, Brit. TV addict: but that aside my opinion about this fourth season is simply smashing.  I was after the second episode afraid that Mr. Fellows had given in to the retread stories are good, new and imaginative stories are bad American Television approach.  However, retread stories told with a vibrancy and fresh ideas was how the season unfolded for the next seven episode. (SIDEBAR: TV Pass is awesome, as you get your shows after they've aired the very next day, and you can accumulate episodes to watch over a long weekend, or just at your leisure.  I have also received the final seven episodes of both series 3& 4 before they were broadcast on American TV.  TV Pass is a good thing to look into if you're like me, and enjoy watching on my on schedule.)
Now back to series 4, I'm not a spoiler so I have to be careful not to reveal anything juicy.  This season was funny, controversial, tender and poignant (break out the large sized box of tissues, and prepare to have to watch scenes over, as you may miss something drying your eyes.) knuckle biting, tense, maddening, exciting, and  just plain Masterpiece Theater at it's best.  Acting, directing, scenery, lighting, music, everything that goes into creating a great production can be found in this fourth series, indeed in all the prior episodes as well.
And so to sum up, Downton Abby season 4 is a don't miss and must own, TV Pass is a great penny saving streaming service, and together the combination ROCKS!!

P.S starting to really CONSIDER dropping Netflix and switching to Amazon Prime. $79.99 a year with benefits, as opposed to my current 7.99+tax streaming only service.  Amazon if you all get into the mail-order DVD rental home distribution arena, and stay away from trying to become the next HBO you'll find that a lot of Netflixer's would jump ship, and sign up for prime.
Huge Downton Fan.  DVD allows me to hook others.  To date have introduced 15 people plus several of their spouses who have now become Downton devotees.
I love the intrigue and complex characters. Beautifully filmed and perfectly acted.  Maggie Smith's "quippy" quirky one liners are absolutely the best.
This has to be the best show on tv aside from the Good Wife...  I think you should watch this show...
Out of town, hence missed the show on Sunday. Paid for HD episode watch on return to stay in sequence.

I was relieved to hear about the outcome of the one character,Gwen. That set the tone for possible good fortune for the others at Downton.  So it getting off to a positive start, and I'm glad. The series has been a source of entertainment for me.  I look forward to watching it.

Could someone tell me if you've had a problem playing the Season 4 DVD on a Bluray? It plays fine on my computer but on my Bluray the video and audio don't sync. Is there a setting somewhere that might rectify this issue? I've read that DVDs WILL play on a Bluray player but not Blurays on a DVD player.

Amazon instant is nice for many reasons, but the lack of CC i9s a pain for those of us trying to purchase items for our aging relatives.  The show is wonderful, but the lack of CC when it is available is not acceptable.
I love the era that the show is based and the characters are great. The story lines are great. Love it.

I preorderd this at a certain price but when it was recently shipped, Amazon notified me that I was getting it at a lesser cost which made it very reasonablel!  I have the entire series now and will watch this over and over.

Season 4 was a disappointment as the plots seemed more or less "thrown at the walls" to see what might stick. However as I had previously bought Seasons 1, 2, 3, I felt I had to pre-order this Season in hopes that things would return to the former quality of the story thread in Season 5...when I love a series I don't want to skip Seasons. Really not loving the "rape" angle for Anna and Bates...we covered all the prison aspects already...Just a plot line developed to maybe distract us from the "hole" left by Matthew's departure...ditto the schizophrenic treatment of the character Thomas...he's a creep in the initial seasons, then he suddenly seems changed and repentant now he's suddenly back to being a weasel...What's up with that? Surely we could give the downstairs as seedy screwed up characters a break and move on to how the upstairs is going to save the estate, raise the little ones particularly Mary's child that no one...not the grieving Grandmothers or Mommy bother to visit...again what's up with that...having lost one's son or husband...it doesn't follow that neither would not focus on the child...
I don't know but my feeling this season was...Good Lord Fellowes "Keep Calm and Carry On" pick up a story line that's not recycled and is vaguely reminiscent of something other than a tawdry soap...quiet flailing and develop the characters you still have. Photography and acting as always excellent...now they just need a clue and a plot.

We were very disappointed to find that about 10 minutes of Season 4, Episode 5, were missing and the DVD "cut out" after the Birthday dinner celebration for Lord Grantham. DVD did not include the surprise band, the dancing, and the downstairs encounter between Rose, Jack, and Mary. Could not find this section either when looking through the scene shots. Wonder if others have had this happen? But, all in all, fabulous production and we shall continue watching this wonderful combination of soap opera and beautiful gowns.
Paid $79 in order to get better shipping and freed video, only to discover I still had to pay 2 bucks to see this one show, even the day after it appeared free on air. Not a good deal at all.

I am a Brit living in the USA, and I really miss UK television. I no longer get cable because I do not think it is worth it.

I have series 2-4 on dvd. I love it because it reminds me of home. However, I think the best ones so far are series 2 and 3.

I was a little dissapointed in Series 4. I am not sure what I expected. Maybe it was the long wait!!! I hope Branson does not have a romance with the school teacher. She does not seem to "fit" somehow. As for Edith. Good Grief. Maybe I am stuck in a time warp not realizing that times have moved on in the series, but having child out of wedlock?? Tsk Tsk. I need to remind myself that times have changed in the series, and her "fall from grace" in that time period is not as shocking. I just recall how digusted she was with Mary's night time excapades.

Anyway, the more British stuff the better. :)

Downton Abbey is one of the best series produced by the BBC. They produce a lot of good quality shows and I have been a fan for many years but this show is so good and the quality actors make it so! I am a fan of English television and BBC and have watched many including Call the MIdwife, another excellent show, but Downton Abbey by far is the best
This show has it all...plus you can learn quite a bit of history while being completely entertained! I Highly recommend watching Downton Abbey!!
What else need I say!! This is the best show around!!! I  love being able to watch it when I am able, not when it is on TV

This is my most favorite period drama ever!!! I get nothing done until I watch all episodes. The characters are all so great, the writing is fantastic, the story lines can border on fairy tale sometimes, but that is what I love!

We have enjoyed Downton Abbey since its premier season, and this season continues to entertain us. For example, we were saddened by the attack on Anna, the one truly unselfish and giving character in the story. Her husband Bates' grief when he finally learned the truth, as well as his loving way of handling the situation when he talked with her is an example of the quality writing and acting in this series.  We hope to see Anna emerge with the knowledge that her true identity as a good, incorruptible, and decent woman could never really be defiled, despite the social misconceptions of the time. We hope the writers have Bates lets go of his desire for retribution, and that the perpetrator is made to stand trial. We also enjoy seeing some characters (such as Tom, Lord Grantham, and Lady Mary) grow into better people through what they've experienced and through a change of thought. All of the actors make us care about the lives of their characters.

We enjoy Amazon's Instant Video service because we can see the program one day after it airs on public television. Since we don't subscribe to cable or Dish TV, this is the most immediate way fo us to see a current program.
Though the first episode started off a little slow the season is now picking up steam with interesting storylines. I am enjoying the relationship between Lady Crowley and the Countess.
Loved Season 4!!  Drives me nuts to wait so long for Season 5.  This show still is first class all the way.
I really enjoy this season, and I can not wait for the next.  The streaming worked really well, and I did not personally need HD to have a great picture and sound.

Love this program and the characters...that this world at one time was about people treating each other with respect and some dignity. I staff on Downton Abbey play their roles so well...almost feel as though it's real time.

This season has many different twists from last season. There are a few surprises this season and I can't wait to watch the next episode. I hope that the actors will continue to enjoy their roles so that they can continue the Series for years to come.
I love this series.  I don't want it to end and I can't wait until Season 5.  Brilliant show!!I just wished we could have it at the same time as the UK.
I didn't think the "plot" nor the characters "tired" one bit!! I only wish American TV had 1/3 the "class"
I enjoy the glamour and the formality of the show.  It is an era that respect and dignity was expected.  The costumes are just fabulous!  It would be nice to have lived at Downton Abbey.

I pre-order this DVD collection every year before it comes out in the US so that I can watch all of the episodes without commercials. It came exactly on the date they expected it to be delivered, even in the snow storm.
The only thing that bothers me is that the PBS telecasts have some small scenes not on the UK show discs. Same as series 2 & 3.

The fourth season of Downton Abbey, like the others before it, is superbly well written and acted.  Each episode is built around some form of suspense and intrigue, and as the family and their retainers enter the 1920s the old ways of life begin to crumble.  As always there are characters to love, to hate and to pity.  Maggie Smith is brilliant in her portrayal of a 19th century grand dame with a secretly modern outlook.  We miss the actors who had to be 'killed off' because they couldn't continue with the series, but their demise is skillfully woven into the ongoing story through new drama and development.  The overall theme has been attempted before with some measure of success - for example To The Manor Born and You Rang My Lord? - but nowhere as cleverly and realistically as Downton Abbey.

I have followed the DOWNTON ABBEY series religiously, thrilled to have access to intelligent, visually appealing, historical offerings on both TV and DVD.  I am very confused, though, about the versions of DOWNTON ABBEY - the PBS broadcast version versus the UK EDITION.  I have noticed some scenes on PBS offering a bit more and now, obvious cuts to scenes in my purchased UK EDITION.  The product description for the UK EDITION  professes to be 'uncut.'  If the UK EDITION is indeed the uncut version, why, then, does PBS include certain parts that have been obviously edited out of the UK EDITION?  And. if I purchase version of DOWNTON ABBEY from PBS, will I get the actual and obviously uncut version?  Again, I am very confused but also do not want to have to purchase both versions.  Is there a version available for purchase other than the obviously edited UK EDITION?  I would be so grateful to anyone making clear what I have found so confusing.  THANK YOU!

Best drama on television, best actors, great plot, and scenery, love the setting and the costumes. Always has an ending that makes you want to see the next episode. Has a wide range of topics, just did not like the episode where Anna got raped.

I LOVE THIS SERIES...WATCHED THE FIRST 3 SEASONS AFTER I HAD SURGERY
AND I AM HOOKED....LOVE THE CHARACHTERS, THE CLOTHES, THE TASTE OF
HISTORY....SOMETHING NEW TO LEARN EVERY EPISODE
I Love the story line of the 2 classes of people. It is such a pretty show to watch. Love the clothes and the castle.

Based on the first four episodes that have been broadcast, it looks like the show has run out of things to say.  The family's problems are so trivial.  Does anyone really care if they raise pigs on the estate of if Tom feels out of place with the upper class?

AWESOME SERIES -

The PBS Series still captivates the viewing audience
and makes you looking forward to the next season.
Thank you for this series, it brings up a lot of discussion points of society and how it has changed, and how those changes have influenced our societies today!

When the last episode of Season 3 was over, I was anxiously awaiting January 5, 2014 to view another episode of this wonderful series.  I was not disappointed!  I am so happy to know that I can purchase and download the episodes to my Kindle and enjoy keeping up with the happenings at Downton Abbey.  The story is magnificent and well written.  To compliment this, the fashions and social structure of that time is fabulous to view and be aware of life in another time and social standing.  Bravo!  The 5 stars are so well earned!
Downton Abbey is wonderful drama that transports the viewer back in time with engaging characters involved in wonderful stories.  I love it!  I wish there were more episodes!

This season seems to be filled with sadness and the darkness of loss.  It would be nice to see some happy occasions as well.  Throughout the seasons you fall in love with the characters and now it is like we are being punished for being loyal.....how about some happy occasions mixed into the bad next season...It's getting rather dark and depressing!!!  I'm ready to see these character show the happy side in the next season!

This is not a kinder, gentler season.  Julian Fellowes is dealing with social issues of the era - race, rape, fascism and folly - through character-driven plot twists.  The characters themselves continue to deepen and there is a roller-coaster feeling where you don't know what the next turn will be.

With Matthew dying at the end of last season, the dialogue in a new season can be stilted.  Not so with Season 4!!  The writers have done a masterful job of working within the characters and all the stories have been natural extensions of the previous season.  Well done!!

And for a little teaser, the darker side of Mr. Bates emerges . . . fascinating!!
Costumes and Maggie  Smith are icing on the cake. The Upstairs Downstairs interplay is fascinating. Julian Fellows, keep writing that marvelous Duchess dialogue.
Love this timeless show.  It is all good.  Only complaint is, wish there were more than 9 episodes!  . Hope there will be many more seasons to come.

I love following the two levels of early 20th Century British society converging ... it looks like they'll get there by the 21st Century .... hummm, therefore we need a 100 more episodes, producers!!!!!

I took my partner through all of the Season 1-3 episodes prior to watching Season 4 ... it was fun to see it all again ...such great TV!!!!!

Yhis season we see new strife between the servants and Mary becomes a mover and a shaker.
Great character development by the writers.
As far as period shows are concerned, this is by far one if the most enjoyable to watch. Our entire family likes Downton Abbey.

I could not believe how many well meaning fans for some reason can't stop themselves from "spoilers". I know that Amazon reviews and claims they check the reviews. I really question whether or not they do and wonder what is worse allowing it or lying about editing the reviews. I guess it speaks in a rather small way how we live in an era of me. One of my most admired friends would quote his Jewish mothers sayings. " it is easier to see a fly on someone's shoulder than an elephant on their own". I remember recently a reporter for a celebrity show gave the plot away on Homeland Part 2 to Drew Barrymore. The pain on Drew's face said it all.
I am not well and often bedridden so I live a good deal of my current life though the tube. The daughter of a now deceased Jazz musician Was asked the age old question about what is the definition of ART!? I never forgot her answer. When she was growing up her father who lived it said it best. Art is something that when you experience it, it takes you someplace.
Downton takes you someplace special. For that brief moment you are in a place that is truly special. Enjoy.
This is still a great series. Some of the chemistry has gone out of Mary's love life, and Edith still gets the short-end of the stick, but it is worth a watch.
Best drama on TV! Compelling look into the inner workings of post WW1 British nobility household. The serving class is wonderfully entwined in the lives of the nobles.

Downtown Abbey is one of the few shows that I find of any interest in these days. It is well written, has suspense,  love stories, tragedies, and the dress and location are excellent for the time period. It also gives us some history lessons.
I can't wait to the next episode or next season.
The DVDs make it possible to watch without commercial interruption.
 I plan on watching all the seasons over again.
The 4th season is great, just like the other season's.
Thanks so much for making this DVD available!

Love all the cast and ALL the story lines!!!! So thrilling each week to see what unfolds!  It is a must see!!!!
Downton Abby is such a fun series to watch.  If you are looking for a good romance, comedy, drama, you should try Downton!

I thought I would not buy DA season 4 because season 3 hit too close to home. However my curiosity did get the better of me
and of course I purchased it. To my surprise it was really very good. The acting remained really great. I think those actors and
actress' could really make anything look good. I remain with the thought that Fellowes should have ended the whole series
with season three . He could have had a happy ending while he still had Dan Stevens. He is talented though and could
write another series on something else. Downton Abbey was originally supposed to end with season 2 but I  guess the
money involved proved to be too much.
I truly love the characters and the humor and drama within the same show. Will be sad when it ends

Nice stereotyped era presentation.  Fairly good plotting with only a few out of character acts to make the story line function.  It's always a pleasure to have a drama where most of the characters are likable in some way.

I thought their handling of Matthew's death was brilliant.  The season could have bogged down badly with a long drawn out funeral, etc.  The new story lines are very intriguing, and the new characters are very acceptable.  It's nice that Moseley finally has a girl!  But what about Daisy?  Is she ever going to find Mr. Right?  Edith's decision to have her baby was a great relief.  Mary's quandry of someone to take Matthew's place has everyone guessing.  I'm not sure that any of the current suitors fit the bill.  And did he, or didn't he?  Mr. Bate's suspicious trip to London certainly makes it appear that he did it!  But, if ever a guy deserved a visit from a vigilante avenger, Anna's rapist sure did!  Way to go, Mr. Bates!  The only thing I didn't like about Season 4?  It's too short, and the wait for Season 5 is going to be tough!

This Season is, understandably a bit darker. The characters are struggling to find themselves and overcome hardship. However, it's still intriguing, sensitive, and warm. I really feel for the characters. I'm very interested to see how things turn out for the family.

Can't wait to see the end even though they killed Matthew off at the end of the last season.  Really wondering if they end up becoming self sufficient or not.

only wish it had been a bit more intense this season....there is always hope, and I will continue to watch!

I'm hooked on this series. I enjoy the careful historical details in the story, as well as the juxtaposition of good and evil, under the very noses of the British aristocracy while they are oblivious to it.

I have followed this show and watched each season waiting for the next.  I was upset at the end of season 3 as were many of the true fans.  This season has been a total letdown for me.  It seems to be more of a soap opera now trying to find a path to take.  I am no longer interested in the characters upstairs except for the tried and true mother in laws of course.  They are proven actresses that give the show some laughs and anticipated scenes.  Downstairs is Anna and Bates which are characters which we love.  Barrows is simply a pain and little else is interesting.  Not connecting with new characters.  All in all, I am done with this series and hope it goes off the air.

Absolutely LOVE Downton Abbey!! The characters all mesh well and the acting is superb. You FEEL as though you are experiencing the life of the characters right along with them. I always anticipate the next showing. I can't get enough!!!

This is one of my favorite shows. Obviously we all miss Matthew and Sybil from losing them in Season 3. It was very hard for me to see how women were treated in that day regarding violent acts against them, and especially if they were in service (not of noble blood). But, it was also an educating moment to help remind me we have come a long way since the 1920's & 30's (and in a lot of ways, have a lot further to go).
DVD arrived Friday and I watched right away.  Love the series and hope it continues a few more years.  Sure, it is a bit "soapy" but so much fun to watch.

Thoroughly enthralling, captivating, & addictive. The characters, storyline, acting, British style, setting, language, etc., it is all very fascinating to me.  I can't wait now for the next season already!  I realize that it's a prime time mini-series, but so well done, it's in a league of its own.
Well written and well executed! Characters have a great deal of depth! I feel as though I know each one personally.

UPDATED:  I re-viewed this Season 4 DVD recently (hoping that my opinion would change - but that isn't the case) and realized that it is missing key scenes.  For example: when everyone is leaving the house party, the scene where Gregson, Samson, and Edith are talking and Gregson returns the IOU to Samson - that ENTIRE scene is missing. There are others missing as well but I don't want to give out any spoilers. So if you think you are purchasing an UNCUT version, this is NOT it.  This same thing happened with the Season 3 DVD (several key scenes are missing).  I don't understand why they eliminate scenes on the DVD version???

I'm  a HUGE fan of this series and couldn't wait until Season 4 premiered here in the U.S.  I already own Seasons 1 thru 3 so when Season 4 was released for sale on Jan. 28, I immediately purchased it.  I won't be giving any spoilers, however, suffice it to say that this Season 4 is just downright TERRIBLE!  There are plot lines that are SO unbelievable you have to scratch your head and wonder if Julian Fellowes and his writers were smoking something.  Example:  in one episode, a character has a huge problem and then the next episode is over 1 year later and the problem is "solved" and all we get is an explanation via words.

Also, Mary has a couple of men interested in her which provides a good story line, however, the first man gets reacquainted with her after many, many years and 3 days later he's professing his undying love for her.  What???

You never get a sense that any of this is believable because it happens SO quickly -- we're never allowed to see the relationships develop like they did between Mary and Matthew or Sybil and Tom or even Anna and Bates.  It's like Julian Fellowes is unsure whether the series will be picked up for another season, so he tries to cram tons of script (much of it unnecessary and not believable) into each episode.

And frankly, the sarcastic-ness between Old Lady Grantham and Mrs. Crawley is really getting very old.  In this Aeason 4, Mrs. Crawley helps Violet to a great degree, yet Violet remains her nasty self with Isobel.  Also, we all know that Bates "saved" Mr. Barrow in Season 3, yet Barrow still continues to be nasty to Bates and Anna.

Lastly, there are some really stupid story lines in this Season 4.  Surely Cousin Rose isn't a total idiot, yet she continuously makes stupid and hurtful decisions again and again.  It's like they gave her a mind of a 4 year old.  And yet once again, Tom Branson is having difficulty adjusting to his life as part of a rich family.  Really??? Hasn't he been living at Downton for the past 3-4 years?  That story line should have been signed-sealed-delivered ages ago.  Enough with that.

And if I hear the words "pig man" one more time, I'll scream!

What I liked?  the clothes, the set decoration, the old cars, and the story line between Alfred (the under-butler) and Daisy, the assistant cook.

This Season is on 3 discs and contains "The London Season" which is the 2 hr concluding episode of this Season 4.

Can't wait for season 5! What will I watch until next season? There is so much junk on TV it is refreshing to watch this family's saga. Very entertaining. It's like a really good book that you can't put down.

I love this Series and now I can watch Season 4!  I am thrilled!  The Blue-ray quality makes a big difference in enjoying all the refined details of the setting and costumes of the characters in this series.
Season 4 of Downton Abbey continues to entertain and satisfy. Like Seasons 1-3, Season 4 is simply wonderful. I love it!

Well written and very historically accurate, the show is the quality one would expect from Masterpiece.  The season closing left me a little blah though - not as dramatic as the end of the last season.

period drama that keeps you entertained and wanting for the next episode. a must see series.
can't wait for the next season
Another wonderful season.  Following the ups and downs of these fantastic characters is a complete delight.  Why are the seasons so short?  It seems cruel.
I don't usually watch anything 'British' but this series has had me take a look at other similar shows and I guess I am hooked on this one. It's well done.
Quality programming the acting is superb you can actually believe these people live in that era. From the costumes to the sets attention was given to every detail.
We are nearing the end of Season 4 and don't want it to end!  Surely wish we didn't have to wait another year for Season 5.

I love this show.  Just started watching and watched the first three seasons in three days.  I have now watched all of season four and fall more in love with this show with every episode.  The writer is amazing with her development of each character and how they interact with each other.
My wife and I are always looking for shows that are appropriate and entertaining to watch and we found just that with Downton! It has everything that you could hope for in a TV show...
Strong characters. Excellent story lines. Great photography and costumes. Surprised at every turn of events. Can't wait for each new episode.
As usual Downton Abbey does not fail to impress. This season again was outstanding-  with a few surprise twists. Very worth the purchase.
I love the romance and drama, and how it is portrayed in the lives of the upper-class English.  I think it shows historical events in a very entertaining light!

Cause this show ROCKS!!
In 16 words or less....killer character development...amazing acting....even my boyfriend loves this show that has to count for something, right?
I love this program and don't want it to end. I care about the characterless, they are real and genuine to me. I am so glad I started watching.

I have watched thru episode 7,and I'm anxiously waiting for the chance to see the next one.
Without spoiling the story, a pivotal situation has occurred that will most probably change several
lives. If they track as I suspect, you will be looking at dangerous drama by the season end.
Excellent acting & writing1 Great cinematography & production values. Just an all around excellent program. Maggie Smith. is so good in this show.
Excellent show and it keeps getting better. I'm a great fan of Downton Abbey. Can't wait for next season! Highly recommended.

This is one of the most wonderful series I have ever watched.  I am a mystery lover so not my normal cup of tea but once I started watching it I could not quit until I was at the end of season 4.  The characters are so perfectly matched to the roles they play that you cannot wait to see what they come up with next.  I would recommend this series to everyone no matter what your normal viewing preferences are.
Every episode I've watched so far this season has been compelling and immensely entertaining.  Some interesting new plot twists and new characters.  One of the best shows on TV in my opinion.

Season 4 picks up 6 months after the death of a major character at the end of season 3.  I wasn't sure, even as well loved as this show is, that they could pull off another season with so much CHANGE in the third.  They pulled off the grief and mourning and moving on for all the characters beautifully.  The sets are lavish and the interplay between characters will keep us coming back each week for as long as they make the series!
Historically accurate for the times (early 1920's) ... great characters ... beautiful scenery ...perfect cast ... well written and acted
I am a Downton Abbey  and couldn't wait for it to come ,each DVD is had me  to see what was to happen

The show was always something of a high-class soap opera, but there has been a steady decline in the level of the writing since Season One. Now, in Season Four, it feels as if the writers are desperate to find any means necessary to spin the plot by throwing anything and everything into the storyline stew. Characters that were legitimately hard-edged and flinty, solidly anchored to the prejudices of their time and class -- like the the Head Butler, the Lord of the Downton, his daughter Mary, and his Mother -- have been softened so much that they now seem cuddly and cute. The art direction and the acting remain first rate, and are now pretty much the only reasons to keep watching.
Great season.  Final episode might be one of the best hours of TV ever made.  The final scene was a quite moving - feel good ending!  Hurry up with season 5.
Another great episode! I don't receive this channel so it's great to be able to watch it through Amazon on my computer.
There is always intrigue and of course fun at the Abbey. The characters find a way into your heart. This season hasn't disappointed!

I was kind of worried that with Matthew gone Downton would take an unhappy tone.  Mary was a little morose for the  first couple of episodes, but it didn't take long for her to get back to life.
The plot had some unexpected twists and turns this season as well!  I was happy that I was able to purchase the TV Pass and view the last four episodes before their television release.  I could not wait to see them!

I am completely hooked on the Downton Abbey series. Season 4 does not have the heart-break of season 3. (Thank goodness.)

If you wonder about Michelle Dockery's acting abilities, she does an amazing job with a few pigs and some mud.  Mrs. Hughes and Carson deliver their usual great performances.  I would hate to have either one mad at me.  The downstairs quartet find some resolution.  I wanted more time with Daisy and Mr. Mason.  Anna and Bates continue their suffering. (Yikes!)  Tom Branson wanders around looking lost.  I have admired him the most in past seasons.  He is climbing a very long ladder.  There is hope for him.  Sadly, Lord and Lady Granthem have become part of the background.  Come on! He is an English Earl, there is a lot more to his story.  Finally, there is Mosely and the Lady Edith.  They have the best story lines and the best performances this year.  Lady Edith has finally stopped being Poor Edith.  There are no roses but she finds strength and quality in loving, losing, and loving again.  Good Job!

Synopsis: Season 4, set in 1922, sees the return of the much loved characters in the sumptous setting of Downton Abbey. It has been six months since Matthew's tragic death and Mary struggles to face the future with her fatherless child, and is encouraged by the family to pick up the pieces.  Mary now finds herself the reluctant object of attention by a number of eager suitors. Cousin Rose is attracted to the bright lights of London which spells trouble for the Crawleys.  Edith's budding relationship with Michael Gregson is threatened by events beyong her control. Downstairs we have Anna who struggles with her guilt of being raped by Lord Gillingham's valet,  Mr. Molesly becomes enarmored with Baxter, Cora's new lady's maid who is somehow beholding to Thomas Barrow, the under butler, who is constantly prodding her to tell secrets she may have heard between the gentry in the Abbey. My favorite character above all is Violet who is played by Maggie Smith.  Take time to sit and watch this series, you will be thoroughly entertained.

NO ONE KNEW what to expect in Season 4 of Downton Abbey  only that the show would go on even though actor Dan Stevens, who played Matthew Crawley, husband to Lady Mary (Michelle Dockery), refused to renew his contract in hopes of pursuing other projects.

Downton Abbey executives, cast and fans took the news hard. The relationship between Matthew and Lady Mary had been the heart of the internationally popular show. In the Meet the New Cast, Hugh Bonnevill, who plays Robert, Earl of Grantham, says, It did feel strange coming back here  to film the first scene a few weeks ago and realizing there was a gap. But, Im sorry guys, no actors are indispensable, and the show and the house and the estate is bigger than any of us.

Executive producer Gareth Neame agrees. Losing a main character is difficult, but now theres a new story about a woman trying to rebuild her life.

Thats the heart of Season 4, watching Mary and the rest of the family and servants get on with their lives. It begins just as we would expect; Marys father, Robert, wants to shelter his daughter  and Mary is in the mood to be coddled. Former chauffeur, now brother-in-law Tom Branson (Allen Leech) encourages Mary to take part in running the estate. Its the Dowager Violet (Maggie Smith), Marys grandmother, who tells her, she alone can choose her fate.

While Mary decides between a life of mourning or activity  and Branson continues to worry about his place in the world and how it might affect his daughter  Lady Edith (Laura Carmichael) gets a chance to shine. Previously plain and unlucky in love, Edith sparkles in a gorgeous new wardrobe and her ongoing relationship with journalist/publisher Michael Gregson (Charles Edwards), who gives Robert a helping hand when least expected. Still, as Edwards explains in the New Cast feature, Gregson has something of a dark past and Ediths problems may not be over yet.

As Downton enters the Roaring 20s  with a defiant Lady Rose (Lily James) determined to keep her family screaming  we are introduced to talented black jazz singer Jack Ross played by Gary Carr. Its easy to see where Rose wants to go with this (What doesn't work is the familys reaction to the relationship; frankly, its not in keeping with the period.) Among other newcomers are two potential suitors for Mary, Lord Gillingham (Tom Cullen) and Charles Blake (Julian Ovender), both engaging and likable. I would like to see Mary be bossed around and see someone able to handle her, Dockery says.

Love is a motivating factor for those downstairs, too  except for Barrow (Rob James-Collier), who continues to scheme and plot just because he can. He brings in a new ally, Baxter (Raquel Cassidy), but is she willing to play along? Footman Alfred (Matt Milne), who longs to be a cook, continues his role as the unwitting focus of Daisy (Sophie McShera) and Ivy's (Cara Theobold) affections, much to the frustration of Mrs. Patmore (Lesley Nicol) and Mrs. Hughes (Phyllis Logan)  and the confusion of butler Carson (Jim Carter). We also delve further into Bates (Brendan Coyle) unique skills.

As a fan, there is nothing like watching Downton Abbey on Blu-ray. The picture is so much more intense, colorful and detailed than in broadcast, even on an HD-TV. Few films  especially TV series  show off their visual riches as well as Downton with its lavish costuming and scenic locations. (Yes, as standard, the season finale takes us to a lavish party with all the eye-candy.) The 2.0 DTS-MA sound mix remains standard, since the show is largely made up of dialogue, which comes through beautifully. Background music usually emphasizes dramatic moments  by now, we all know the cues  but the jazz moments are clearly defined. As always, these are the unedited British shows, available on both the Blu-ray and DVD.

There are 3 discs in the Blu-ray and DVD sets, and 9 episodes. HD bonus features are brief, each about 10 minutes long. They include Downton Diaries, a video diary of a day on-set led by Sophie McShera, and a making-of feature exploring Season 4, with an emphasis on costumes. The best is Meet the New Cast, that introduces the new actors and their characters, and provides a look at how Season 4 came together.

Creator/writer Julian Fellowes gives viewers time to acknowledge Matthews loss, then masterfully leads us into the new plot threads and characters. It leaves me hoping that Fellowes will take us much further into the Downton story than the projected Season 5 finale.   Kay Reynolds

I have nothing but sympathy for Julian Fellowes. Last season, "Downton Abbey" lost two lead characters when the actors portraying them decided they wanted to leave the show. No one could have anticipated that, so Season 4 of the show is really a rebuilding season. I was very, very worried for the first half of the season, which is just....really bad. Things do pick up considerably halfway through, but I still think this is the weakest season of the show by far. Without giving too much away, there is a terrible plot involving Anna that I absolutely hated...LEAVE THE BATES'S ALONE!!!!

Many of the other plots this season are either bad, annoying, or just downright stupid. Daisy has never been my favorite character, but the dull love triangle between her, Ivy, and Alfred quickly grows tiresome. Edna returns to Downton for a stint as Cora's new lady's maid, and she is such a troublemaker! I hate her! Edith has always been an annoying and stupid character, and her storyline takes some ridiculous turns this season. Fellowes couldn't even really come up with anything original for her; he just recycles another character's storyline from earlier in the season. I also think that Maggie Smith is drastically underutilized for the first half of the season (fortunately she compensates for it in the later episodes, with some of her best zingers to date). Sherley MacLaine returns for the final episode reprising her role as Cora's mother, and again I was very disappointed in her performance, feeling that she was vastly underutilized. Paul Giamatti's guest role as Cora's brother is slightly more interesting, but just kind of odd.

The best thing about the season by far is Lady Mary's storyline, focusing how she deals with Matthew's sudden death and takes on a more central leadership role at Downton. While I loved the Mary/Matthew romance and was very sad when Dan Stevens departed from the cast, I have come to believe that Matthew was sort of holding Mary back. We see more of the old Mary this season, the strong, unyielding Mary, who will likely be the reason for Downton's survival. There's also some romance as Mary considers getting back into the dating game, but she takes the whole courtship thing slow. We are left with two primary suitors for Mary, and while they're both okay blokes, I have to wonder if someone better suited for Mary might come along next season.

Another surprise for me this season was how entertaining Rose's character has become. She was super annoying last season, but provided some much-needed comic relief this time around. Also, Isobel has always irritated me to no end, but that wasn't the case this season. Her character undergoes a bit of a transformation as she copes with the death of her only son and slowly returns back to life. Penelope Wilton delivers some great performances.

Aside from Anna's tragedy, there wasn't anything super shocking this season. I think Fellowes let the audience off easy, and Season 5 will probably consist of many more deaths and dramas. I hope that's the case, and that it's much better than Season 4.

We received our copy yesterday and had a Downton Abbey marathon last night....Whoa it's great, and tonight we'll finish Season 4 off
We can't wait for Season 5!

I watched the first three seasons over a several day period.  It was a heavenly way to recover from Christmas.  I prefer to view the episodes on my Kindle Fire with headset.  Beautifully done series......Such up to date thoughts poised in a time long ago.  I rave to everyone who will listen.

Season 4 keeps the drama coming, but still such a wonderful show! I recommend watching this show to everyone I know that enjoys period pieces and British everything :)
As an American I have been waiting, and finally it continues.  I love, simply love, this wonderful series.  How could you not ?

Watched season four in one sitting with my husband.  The Blu-Ray is crisp and gorgeous.  The sound is awesome.  And of course the UK version is uncut and shown the way it should be.  Why would anybody want the US version is beyond me.

Now for the season.  **Spoilers**

Having lost one of my favorite characters, Matthew.  I was afraid where Fellowes would go with this season.  Not to worry as it is an amazing production!  The acting is second to none.  And the costumes, sets, scenery, is just stunning in it's entirety.  WOW.
Yes it started off a little slow but as I remember so did every season.  Patience is well rewarded.  So historically accurate and delicious.

Anna's story is intense and very difficult to watch.  This could have gone over the top but Joanne Froggatt plays Anna with such conviction and helplessness that you ache for her.  Plus she nailed what a woman goes through after a violent rape.  People must remember this was the 1920s and the attitude "let sleeping dogs lie" was in force.  Child abuse and rape were taboo subjects with very few women (especially servants) getting justice.
I love the character John Bates(Brendan Coyle).  He is I feel the strongest written character in the series.  You just never really know what he will do.  Revenge?  Pick pocket?  Forger?  A man of many talents.  And I fist pumped when Lady Mary found the "ticket" and then burned it later!
Ah Lady Mary(Michelle Dockery).  We see her go through depression and then pull herself back to the living.  So damn British and beautifully written.  Watching her wear black and slowly transform back to color,as she goes through her sadness, is well done.  And now the story starts with the suitors that appear and how she handles that next life chapter.  She has grown so and now we see the mature, responsible Mary.
Lady Edith's(Laura Carmichael) story was sad again.  Poor thing just can't find any happiness and I want her so badly to find some. And there were times I wanted to call her a twit and say "Grow Up"!!!  Maybe in season 5 she can finally find love?  And now a baby added.
As always the Earl(Hugh Bonneville) and Lady Cora(Elizabeth McGovern) are incredible characters.  What they deal with this season is poignant and real.  But there is also a good dose of humor and intrigue to be had.  He turns a character who could have been a cliche into someone who feels very real to me. Bravo, Hugh!
Violet Crawley(Maggie Smith) and Isobel Crawley(Penelope Wilton) are two of the best written characters on television, period.  The exchanges they make.  The friendship they show when one is in need.  The love they really share.  Just outstanding! " I wonder your halo doesn't grow heavy. It must be like wearing a tiara around the clock".  "Just because you're an old widow, I see no necessity to eat off a tray".
Tom Branson(Allen Leech), Lady Rose(Lily James), Lady Rosamund(Samantha Bond) have all good stories to add this season.  We now see the flappers and Jazz coming to England.  Lady Rose trying to piss off her mother.  Tom becoming a stronger and more interesting character.  It's all good.
I love the downstairs crew.  As always we see Thomas(Robert James-Collier) trying to be his scheming, conniving self which is too bad but then a Leopard can't change his spots can he?
Mr. Carson(Jim Carter) shown very human and funny.  Another great character!  Mr. Carson: But what does it matter anyway? We shout and scream and wail and cry, but in the end we must all die.
Mrs. Hughes: Well. Thats cheered me up. Ill get on with my work.
And then that brings us to Mrs. Hughes(Phyllis Logan) in a brilliant role/character.  She is the heart and soul of Downton Abbey.  The keeper of the keys.  The one they all go to for a cuppa and a cry.  Its not for me to have an opinion. But I will say this  Mrs. Hughes
Mrs. Patmore(Lesley Nicol) just as feisty as always this season.  She is just hilarious but also very tender hearted which makes her character one of my favorites.  Cora: Mrs. Patmore, is there an aspect of the present day that you can accept without resistance.
Mrs. Patmore: Oh milady. I wouldn't mind gettin' rid of my corset.  Just so good!
Daisy(Sophie McShera), Ivy(Cara Theobold), Alfred(Matt Milne) great story between the three of them this season.  And I'm sad to see Alfred go but glad we still have Daisy.  Here's another character, Daisy, that is maturing nicely.
The story with Molesley(Kevin Doyle) and newbie Baxter(Raquel Cassidy) is going to be interesting.  What is Baxter hiding?  Will Molesley find love with Baxter?  I like Baxter and am glad we have a new character that is not mean or conniving.

I enjoyed seeing the suitors of Mary.  Likewise the emotions and torments shown by all this season.  Guest stars Shirley MacLaine and Paul Giamatti were fabulous.  And the sparring between Violet and Martha Levinson is not to be missed!!!  Some things I would have changed.  The whole Edith thing was a little far fetched.  And I really think that Anna should have told John what happened.  As close as they are how could she not tell the love of her life?  Unbelievable.
Still I love this production.  The acting, costumes, history, music and scenery are enough to watch Downton Abbey but I also love the characters and writing (even when it's over the top).
;)
It never fails to draw you in.  Enjoy watching people and circumstances change in the Downton world.  It is like a history lesson in the changing world after WW1.
We don't have cable and I am so glad we can watch Downton through Amazon Prime. We are now going back to be beginning and watching them all over again. Thanks Amazon for providing this great service!

One of my favorite pastimes is to download Downton Abbey from Amazon.com  It is so simple and in a matter of minutes, I am watching Season 4.

Episode 1, is, as expected, very sad as the viewer is reminded (in almost every scene) of the tragic ending to Matthew Crawley's life.  However, the introduction of Cousin Rose in Season 3 added some much needed excitement and challenge to the storyline.  This "Downton Abbey Diva" has breathed new life into the Crawley-Grantham household.  Who doesn't love to follow an adorable troublemaker with good intentions?

What happens to Anna is totally unexpected and unnerving.  It compels viewers to speculate if the truth will ever be revealed and, if so, will Mr. Bates be able to restrain himself???  And, what will Lady Mary have to say about it?  This is a good Segway to Lord Gillingham; a debonair gentleman to say the very least and a brilliant addition to the cast as Lady Mary's new, adoring suitor and "Glamourous Pirate" as duly named by Lord Grantham.  Bravo Tony Foyle!!  I do hope that you stay for more than one season.

The elimination of O'Brien & Braithwaite is a relief! These two "Lady's Maids"  were beginning to bore me. Besides, who likes to follow troublemakers with bad intentions!  Poor Branson, he is like a fish out of water -- someone please throw him a line so that he can save himself, "Sibby" & Downton.  I am glad to see that the house has embraced Thomas, all in, as he continues to be a  sly, yet entertaining troublemaker!  As for Mr. Carson's trip down "Memory Lane," I should hope that there is more to this later in the season -- really, Mr. Carson, who are you? The curiosity of a possible love affair between  Isobel Crawley & Doctor Clarkson is just killing me-LOL!

Saving the best for last ~ How truthful is Lady Edith's Editor and will she dare trust him enough to walk down the aisle again?  Thank you,  Maggie Smith (Violet) for your incredible acting.  You have such a convincing way of delivering those "Pearls of Wisdom" to all!

I can't wait for this Sunday so I can download the next episode of Downton from Amazon onto my Kindle Fire.

I love the show.
Viewing it was problem free ... no streaming problems.
Love the high definition on my television.
I am totally enthralled by this show and this wonderful story. I will watch until there is no more. Fascinating!

Just received my pre-ordered copy of Downton Abbey Season 4, so as soon as I get the time I can watch the whole season before it is aired in the U.S.  Love this series and love that I can pre-order the seasons.
Great acting and the theme is delightful. I would recommend it.  Interesting character development. Good family drama.  A must see!

I thought I could not bear a season without Sybil and Matthew.  However, this is the best season yet.  I cannot schedule a weekly viewing at home and could not bear to miss an episode therefore, I purchased this season!
Love it.  What a masterpiece. It was worth the price I paid . I just ordered season 4. Thank you

I love the costuming, the props, the background scenery and many of the characters.  The movie is successful as it touches on many issues we face - pride, loneliness, confusion, joy, happiness, love, moral issues, family, loyalty, dishonesty, etc.  I especially like that it is, basically, a clean production.  The language is minimal and IT IS very refreshing to allow our imagination to take us where the cameras do not.
Love this series and Season 4 is definitely starting  off great!  I can't wait for the remainder of the season!

Ohh the shared agony of the idle rich and those "in service" as they contemplate a future without the grace of a rigidly enforced caste system. This portrait of aristocracy and the inherent nobility of the natural order is filled with predictable skirmishes, faux crisis and tragedy -- all tastefully executed between wistful glances back at what made the 'Empire' such fun.

I could probably give the new season a 5-star rating, but I didn't because I miss the cast members who have moved on. I also prefer the initial setting in terms of the era depicted. So, I guess I'm like Mrs. Pattmore, fighting against the "new ways" and innovations that are inevitable, as is change itself! Still love it, though, and will continue to watch as time marches on.

Jan-30-2013 No spoilers here. Last night I finished watching the entire 4th season, and must say that the picture quality of the Blu-rays far exceeds what we see during the PBS HD broadcast. And John Lunn's music, as always, sounds wonderful. While the season may have had some disappointments, noted by myself and others when we began watching early episodes on PBS in the U.S., enough happens in later chapters to redeem it, and while it certainly wasn't perfect, there are sufficient interesting plot points to set the stage for future intrigues in the seasons that will surely follow. And I was pleased with the special features. One point: The final episode is 2 3/4 hours long, referred to as "The London Season," and I was amazed at how quickly those nearly 3 hours flew. And the 3 behind the scenes specials are, in total, about 36 minutes, and even though they fly (because they're so fascinating), they seemed longer than that. I just love this series and now have 4 seasons of it on Blu-ray and my appreciation of it hasn't diminished.
Some of the characters take some pretty extreme courses throughout this season. Once I started watching with my fiance, we couldn't stop until it was over.

Since Amazon's look like packing info:

Includes The London Season, the Season 4 finale--8 months after the season ending

Over 30 minutes of bonus video...
The Making of  . ..
Meet the New Cast
(A lot of the same stuff that shows up on PBS, 10 minutes each.)

Downton Diaries
(The Highclere and Ealing film sites hosted by Laura Carmichael and Sophie McShera, respectively. Basically a day in the life on each set. YMMV, but I could watch these two for hours. Sadly, this is 10 minutes.)

Blu-ray is 8.75 hours in duration. This US Blu-ray includes the same 9 episodes that broadcast in the UK. In order to view this product on US players, the content has been converted from a PAL to NTSC frame rate resulting in approximately 2 additional minutes per episode. The program content is the same.

(What this means is that you get the UK 45 minute episodes instead of the US 50 minute episodes--except for the first two, which were shown in the US as one long ep. The extra five minutes were footage cut from the UK version to make room for ads. Which means if you've been taping the show, your version is longer than the one you'll pay for.)

I like the show, enough to have bought the UK discs from Amazon UK when they were available months ago. If you did that, you won't get anything more by buying these. What I don't like is the marketing decision to just transfer the UK stuff to US format without adding a thing--like the extra scenes. No odds for betting that a Producer's Cut of full length eps will appear after the final season.

The characters and plot are always evolving and growing.  There is a bridge between the aristocrats and the serving class, and the characters cross over it each week to reveal their humanity and the common bond they share living at Downton Abbey.

Almost the epitome of PBS's great offerings to us on Sunday nights.  I won't go into details as others have done this admirably but will just add that I am fascinated by the story, the actors/actresses, the buildings, the wardrobes and especially Maggie Smith.  The twists and turns keep me enthralled and I can't comprehend someone with Julian Fellowes' imagination.  But thank goodness, there he is, writing furiously to keep us highly entertained these past several years.
I love the show and am so glad I can see each episode only a day later.  Thank you for having it available.

Great historical storyline, wonderful photography, compelling acting -- it's all there.  My only complaint is that there is more violence and a faster pace this season than there was in the early series.  We have enough of that in the US, and it was nice to be able to reply on BBC mini-series for a more relaxed, healthy pace.

I cannot stop watching this intriguing view of life in post-victorian England.  The cast and writing is of superior quality.  I miss seeing Matthew!  The writers are very bold to stick to the realities of life, however  and depict how things seem to fall apart for everyone and anyone regardless of their station in life.  Pain is pain, and no amount of money can ease the strife of losing a loved one.  May this series continue to inspire and entertain as there are few series available on television with such quality programming. Downton Abbey reaches viewership of all ages.
Thank you PBS for your continual and inspirational programming.
For any Downton Abbey follower, you need to see it again and again to pick up on all the dialog missed on the first showing.  I often pick up more lines on the second or third viewing.
I love it simply in terms of sheer entertainment value. I care about the characters and want to see their stories progress. It is engrossing and invigorating and for anyone who likes good drama.
Still an amazing series that never disappoints! I always look forward to more! I highly recommend season 4 to everyone!

The video content of course is great.  I don't like the commercial advertisements at the front end of disc one though, when I pay for something, I don't want to suffer through the ads.  Also the discs labels do not have a menu of what episodes are on what disc, they are just labeled disc 1, etc.  With 9 episodes on three discs it would be nice to know which episodes are on which disc.

I gave it four stars because it's Downton Abbey, but honestly it wasn't as good a seasons past. Not a lot going on as far as excitement goes. It seems to be the season where they are setting the scene for the fifth season...laying the groundwork so  to speak. I cannot wait for the next season, so that says something I suppose.

IT simply the best series I have ever watched.  Production, sets, costumes, performances all quite captivating.  And that I'm certain, is echoed by countless others as well. I mean really, what else can come close?  Thank you for excellence PBS!
A perfectly well rounded show! This series should become a classic!  What a treat it must be to be an actor on this show.
Excellent drama series! I watch and re-watch every episode! It's a must watch every Sunday at my house! Love it!
My daughter bought me season 1-3 for Christmas...and I am now a total addict!!...I see a season 4 marathon in my future!
Absolutely Love this series...  Crammed 3 seasons into 1 month to catch up to Season 4!!! Truly a Masterpiece!!! I'm hooked!
Downton Abbey is such a classy and riveting series-well acted, brilliantly written, beautifully filmed. I like being able to watch the whole season before my friends here in America.

I didn't watch the first 3 seasons since I didn't think I would care for it. All my friends kept saying I really should watch. So just before season 4 started I watched series 1,2,and 3 constantly till I was caught up. I have watched all episodes on Amazon since season 4 has started !!  this show is addicting !!
Watching Downton Abbey with a glass of wine is even better than sex!  I don't give it 5 stars - I give it 10!

This program continues to amaze, surprise, entertain, and awe the viewer.  There are some segue issues along the way, but mostly they are appropriate so that the story does not get bogged down.  Most of the characters show growth and the wisdom of experience.  Some heartbreak, some sadness, some drama, some fear, some dread, some hilarity all set to entertain.  I much enjoy Downton Abbey as a period piece that has terrific scripts, great acting, as well as exquisite scenery and costuming that exemplify each season's era.  Just wonderful, not to be missed.

THIS SEASON HAD WAY TOO MANY "FILLER EPISODES." THAT WAS THE HORRIBLE PART. ON THE UPSIDE, I WANTED TO SEE EACH EPISODE;  JUST TO FIND OUT WHAT HAPPENED NEXT, ONLY TO BE DISAPPOINTED THAT IT WAS YET ANOTHER "FILLER EPISODE," MEANING NOTHING WAS EVER RESOLVED OR SOLVED! THE LAST EPISODE (EPISODE 9) JUST PLAIN SUCKED! :(

This series is so personal, dynamic, and creative that We feel like they are family: we laugh at the human foibles of the characters; we share their concerns and challenges; we grieve as they grieve; and we celebrate their triumphs along with them.  I cried at Matthew's death, and my grief and worry over Mary and her newborn periodically returned throughout the remainder of the year.  What a rare, glorious essay on the human condition!

I Only started watching it cause I heard alot about it but I didn't think it was going to be for me.... Now im hooked !!! I binged watched the first 3 seasons in 2 days. The clothing,buildings and scenary are so spot on. Love the show!!!

In my opinion, the other seasons were better, we are at episode 6 already and the most shocking revelation was Anna's assault, I think we are going to concentrate on the estate and it's finances, the characters are leaving, Branson off to America? Mary giving up on Tony so soon, I think Edith has trouble coming with her new and much deserved beau, I am a devout fan and have loved Downton since episode one of season one, I hope this won't be the last of it but the story lines will certainly be slimmer and harder to come across something fiery... this is just my opinion, of course, we can always look forward to see what Bates does to the valet, hmmmm..

My wife is a HUGE fan of this show. Now, I love many examples of British drama and comedy. But I just don't see the appeal of this show. Not at all.

Since it's only been available on television and we've only got the one TV, that means I have to watch this show a lot more than I want to. So when I saw this, I knew I had to get it for her. That way, she'll be able to watch it on her own when I put them on her iPad.

She says it's a great show and she's been loving the season so far, especially now that she doesn't have to worry about whether or not I will "accidentally" forget to record the show.
This is one of my favorite shows of all time, but after a dramatic end to season 3, I was a little bummed with the first episode. Still the best show on tv, though!

Amazing series, fantastic performances, addicting storyline! Thanks to Amazon prime, I was able to watch the programme from beginning to current episode and what a treat that was. Gladly paid to see season 4, since I intend to purchase all seasons eventually anyway.

All of the characters represent the depth, width and height of human experience.  From the opulence of the Edwardian aristocracy down through the lower cast system: cooks, butler, footman, food servers, and maids in waiting.  My hats off to Julian Fellows for his creation of this monumental epic.

This is a soap opera but still so well made that you can not be critical. All the acting is of a high standard with out all the excess emotions of similar American stories; just a fine production all around and worth of all the ratings
I love this series  Very well acted, photographed and whst a beautiful setting.  I would recomend this to all  Beautiful

Ordered Season 4 on Blu-Ray and paid for overnight shipping so I could receive it right away. Watched the entire season Monday/Tuesday and I find I must make a comment or two on my most favorite show.

Obviously I love this show.  However I am wondering if I am the only person who thought that Season 4 which consists of only 8 regular episodes, not including the end of year special, was a bit short? Other seasons had more episodes so I was bit disappointed with the length of this season.

However, I'm thinking that Season 4 was shorter than normal due to the issues that Season 4 had to deal with, i.e. mostly Mary's life after the loss of Matthew.  Personally I feel Season 4 did it's job to establish a life for Mary after Matthew but I still miss Matthew's character.  Wondering what other's think.

Hopefully I won't spoil the show for anyone else when I say what in the heck is wrong with Mr. Fellowes?  Apparently the writer of our beloved Downton Abbey cannot let anyone be happy for to long.  Take the story line for Anna who is one of my favorite characters and someone who deserves some happiness after Mr. Bates being in prison.  Then there is the long suffering Edith.  It was bad enough for Edith to be jilted at the altar in Season 3 but now Edith has to endure more agony in Season 4.  Daisy continues to be Daisy with no one that really cares about her other than Mrs. Patmore in a sweet and caring motherly type fashion.  Finally by the way - what the heck is up with Thomas?  Just when you thought he had grown a heart, and others came to his aid in Season 3, they've got him being the downstairs jerk again.

While I love Downton Abbey and continue to watch, and watch again, each season until the next comes out it seems that Season 4 was the year to basically retool the show.  While I did like Season 4 I can't say I loved it as much as the other seasons and it was not solely due to the loss of Matthew.  To me, the best episode was the end of year special.

Honestly I think I'm a bit irritated at the writing and storylines of let's make everyone suffer and be miserable most of the time.  While I wait for Season 5, and will watch as Downton Abbey continues as my favorite show, I will say that I felt Season 4 had the potential to be really grand and I feel that Mr. Fellowes missed the mark. Thus the 4 star rating instead of 5.

Smart writing! Great characters, intriguing storylines... Still a wonderful show.

I am very curious to see how the season unfolds.

This is a very well written series with a great cast executing the story with a set/wardrobe that pays such marvelous attention to historical detail. It is truly refreshing to watch a dignified series that allows the imagination fill in the sexual innuendo.
Great show. Highly recommend. I look forward to it and eagerly await each next episode.  It pulls you right in. And the characters are totally believable.
I have become quite addicted to this series and being that I don't have the option of watching on Masterpiece, this is the perfect solution. As a matter of fact, this is better than watching on tv.

This well produced, well acted series continues to be entertaining - an "intelligent soap opera."  As we approach the more modern world, and see the changes of the 20s and 30s reflected more and more in the sets and plots, the charm may fade, but for the moment the series retains much of its charm even after four year.

It is such a pleasure to be able to watch DA on Amazon Prime; I too often forget to watch on PBS on Sundays.  The series seems to have more depth than last time, more interest in changing economic structures, more emphasis on Tom's awkward position, more attention to the delightful interchange between Mrs. Crawley and Maggie Smith (to mix character names and actor's).
enjoying the way the story is involving upstair and downstair characters.keeps interest and curiosity to see what will happen next
What can I say about this series other than it is very British. That's what I love about it. The characters interact well with each other and the costumes and sets are amazing. Love it!

Downton Abbey is hands down one of the best series to date. The writing is excellent, the intro music is enjoyable (unlike "Rescue Me:s intro music/noise) and the characatures are totally well acted and quite beleivable. And that's not to mention the story line. There is varied intrigue on several levels with each episode. Oh, and one more thing. For those (like me) who often struggle with being able to clearly hear what is said when spoken in the british accent, not a problem here at all. I'd give it 10 stars if I could. From Season 1, to season 4.
Love the acting and true-to-life costumes. Story line is a bit predictable at times but this season is much better than last  Can't wait for next one

I love this show, and having access to the entire season before it ends on PBS is wonderful. I also love to watch the UK version. Finally, the quality is perfect. I hook up my MacBook to my tv via HDMI and it looks GREAT. Couldn't be happier.

Normally I don't enjoy episodic shows, mini-series, and the like. This one is very entertaining and all the more remarkably so for being written not by a group but by only one person. Maggie Smith is in good company with an entire estate-house full of really good actors and set-designers and lighting technicians and camera directors. The show is almost addictive.
Thank you Amazon for making several episodes available at a time-we enjoy this series every week.  Excellent story lines, wonderful casting/actors!!

I can understand why this program is so popular even with the entertainment world. Superb acting and the costumes and period surroundings make this story so believable and make you wanting it not to end.
Was hooked from the first season. Waiting for Season 5 to see what happens next. You will enjoy Downton Abbey!
My husband is out of town when it airs.  I watch it when it airs and then watch it again when he watches it! Thanks for posting it quickly!
I came into this series late so had so catching up to do.  This series is very good.  I have enjoyed it immensely.
The great writing, the drama, and the humor continue this season at Downton Abbey.  Dame Maggie Smith is phenomenal.  Waiting for Season 5!

I think this is one of the best shows on TV.  I look forward to watching each week.
Each character has so many facets to them
new characters add to the existing story lines and returning ones continue to impress with terrific acting.  Enjoying this season so far!
My husband and I watched  all 4 seasons in less than two weeks.  Now we hate that we have to wait til next January for more.  Really like the quality of acting.

This program provides an exceptional look into the lives of a connected group of people.  Even though their exact living situation is nothing like anything that would exist today, the themes of their relationships, reactions, ideas, heartache, and joys resonate with today's world as they are timeless.
This is a wonderful program. I love being able to re-watch or catch up by watching episodes on Amazon Prime.
We love it and have enjoyed all 4 seasons- It's a keeper and we cant wait for season 5 next year
Wonderful acting,  writing,  and story. There are so many adventures going on that my interest is consistently piqued. Love Mr and Mrs Bates.
Episode diddn't drag on mr. Bates learning of rape. Mrs Hughes being strong and forceful  show is so very entertaining
This is a great series! Keeps me coming back! The characters do a great job of potraying the era. Thank you for having this available.

This show pulls you in and keeps you there. You can identify with both the upper and lower classes. It has a realism without being trite. The costumes and set design are fabulous! An escape to another time and place that is altogether most pleasant.
Refreshing to see something real and not just reality TV.  Love the characters and the story line and the relationships between the family and the staff.
Lots and Lots of Drama , .no bad language which is a plus , they changed rapidly with the keeping up with times, costumes ect..
Nothing speaks more to literature than a great drama that excels at using proper historical context and highly elegant discourse.

When this first became available on Amazon, I didn't think that I would be interested in it.  I decided to watch a couple of episode and both me and my wife enjoyed it very much.  Now it is the first thing my wife asks on Mondays - "Is the new Downdon Abbey available yet?"

After last season's ending, was not sure that the show could survive.  But the writers have done a wonderfully smooth job of taking Downton Abbey forward and in to the modern age.  The story is wonderfully written and the actors are all simply a joy to watch.  If you are hesitating on this season, don't, it is as enjoyable and the same quality as the previous 3.
Enjoy the scenery, the costuming is magnificent. Love the stories within the story and the intrigue. Always wish the season were longer.
This is an excellent series. We thoroughly enjoy watching each episode. We can't wait for each new season to become available.
If you've not yet watched this series, what are you waiting for!  It's amazing!  Great writing, quick moving story, very entertaining and an interesting look at life in the early 20th century.
I have followed each season of Downton Abbey.  It is beautifully written, superbly acted and I enjoy the historical accuracy.  I highly recommend this series to anyone that may enjoy good TV.

I think the show is wonderful and I think Amazon Prime customers should be able to have it included with their Membership.
Its like giving someone something good and taking it away from them in the same move.
The Mrs. and I are "hooked" on this program. It's a regular "Peyton Place." Can't wait to see the next episode!!
Love the show  --  however, many of the segments have sound issues. I have found this to be true in every season.
As compelling as ever! The costumes, story lines don't fail to grab your attention from the first epidsode. I love this Masterpiece Theater offering. Just heard they're on for season 5. yeah!
Even though it's season 4, it is still fresh . There is always a certain " soap opera" feel to the show, yet it is not an issue due to great acting , writing .
Enjoyable ,intriguing , true to the era , this series drew us in and keeps us waiting to see what the next developments will be at Downton Abbey.
I look forward to each episode and have to stop myself from watching more than one each night.  Can't wait for the next installment.

Can't believe I have watched all of the episodes so far and I'm a all caught up now. I would stay up all night watching each episode.  Felt like a kid not going to bed when I was supposed to!!! Can not believe how hooked on it I am.....

Not happy!!

Edit of Review - Upon calling customer service they processed a full refund and sent a return label.
I appreciate their help!!

I went back recently and watched this series from the very beginning.  It is an early 1900s soap opera.  Same family problems we have today, but they seem to have a little more class.  If you have not seen this series from the beginning, do yourself a favor and watch it all.
I love this series and this season has started better than last year.  I look forward to each week's episode.  I look forward to all the rest.
Epic show! I love this and am sadly addicted to it. Lots of new twists and after last season debacle it is a welcome change....

What can I say.  I love this series. The characters, the plot, the scenery, all transport you back to a time where things were very different, but in a way still the same.
I love this series.  The sets, the characters and the actors/actresses playing the roles are top shelf.  IMHO the series beats anything being played on TV here in the states.
I love this series...couldn't wait till it came across the pond!!  It's a series I will return to in the future.  A timeless classic!
The writing for the show is amazing. Each cast member has alittle something for you to love or hate. Every new episode keep you wanting more. Its my new addiction.
I love, love, this show! And love having each episode available to me as they air with no commercials to interrupt the flow.  Having a season pass is the only way to go..
I got about 10 minutes into it and the video started doing all kinds of weird things.  I retried it but the same thing happened and I never was able to watch it.
