reminded me of why i loved seasons 1-3 so much. some characters are easy to love, some easy to love to hate...but these are characters who i understand and i can follow their decision making process...
Of course we all want to live in a mansion like that :P  I just think the plot is very interesting because is showing both lives the above stairs and the below stairs :)
I love the series and will continue to watch, but it needs some freshness in the story. The new characters need a bit more refinement too.
I missed an episode of Dowton and was glad to be able to get it through Amazon. I had to pay $2.99 for it, but I guess it was worth it to be able to keep up. Free would have been better though!
I can't always see it when it's on t.v. so I love being able to catch up on the internet. One of only two shows I watch regularly on t.v.
I would recommend Downton Abbey to anyone who likes stories with lots of characters and many subplots.  The set is beautiful and the cinematography is amazing.
Love this series! It's a great one to watch with family and friends. From episode 1 season 1 it's been addicting.

I'm liking it better now that Bates knows what happened to Anna. Up until this episode, I thought the series was a dim shadow of its former self. It was so dependent on the Mary Matthew relationship in the first three seasons, I didn't see how it could survive the loss of Dan Stevens. The first 4 episodes were just proving me right. But now that I've seen the murderous gleam in Bates's eyes, I'm finding myself looking forward to it again.
I love Downton Abby. The characters are real, the story line always has a surprise, and the costumes are true to the time period.

This show is awesome! The period in time is spot on with the clothing, speech, events. Each actor in the show has really gone above and beyond for the portrayal of the position in the household they play. History buffs will enjoy this series!
The season is just as entertaining as the previous seasons.  I appreciate the continuity of characters and the continuation of the storyline from Season 3
So many twists and turns, and the characters are fascinating! I am transported to another place when I am in my "Downton Abbey "world.
Absolutely hated the rape direction of the series as I'm sure you have heard by now. This series seems to be going in slow motion.

Frustrating though it might be to see our beloved Downton characters making choices that are against their own best interests, at least the writers are giving them a consistency that makes the story lines believable. With lush yet moody sets, the ever fabulous costuming, and superb acting -- the best anywhere -- Downton Abbey just keeps getting better. And what a wonderful history lesson it is!

I enjoyed the first 3 seasons. I am unable to watch when it airs on TV.  So I will enjoy watching at my leisure.  The quality is wonderful. And I can watch as many times as I want.  I would recommend it to anyone.
great storyline .i think the characters are endearing and believable . i love the clothes and setting of the show. makes me want to go to there to see it for myself.

I love the continuing story of the aristocracy and the servants, all in a time in history when everything was changing for all levels of society.  The vintage clothing and cars make it even more interesting. The total accuracy of even the smallest details of these people's lives makes the story line believable.
I CANNOT WAIT FOR THE NEXT EPISODE.  THIS IS THE BEST THING TO COME ALONG SINCE GWTW.  I WILL CERTAINLY WATCH.

I'm not purchasing Season Four because it is such a huge disappointment.  Frankly, when Dan Stevens chose to leave the series the intelligent move on the part of Fellowes and the producers would have been to hire another actor to play "Matthew" so that the storyline of his and Mary's marriage and Matthew's moving into the role of running the estate could have been continued because Matthew was the "future" -- he was the young professional class -- an attorney -- who had inherited an estate and married into the aristocracy and at the same time saw that Branson, his Irish servant class  brother-in-law, was going to be a partner in the modernizing of the Downtown estate.  There were many stories that could proceed from that -- but by "killing" the character of Matthew,  Fellowes basically "killed" the core of the series.  Frankly, if he was going to kill the Matthew character, he may as well have ended the series altogether because the writing and plotlines in season four so far -- are inferior and reflect bad daytime soap opera writing.  Only the Dowager and Matthew Crawley's mother have any good lines and far too few IMO,  having Anna raped and then treat Bates like dirt in order "to save him from himself" for fear he would attempt to avenge what happened to her is a moment of "jumping the shark" which no series can afford to do and keep its audience.  The introduction of Edna as Cora's maid had no point.  The new ladies' maid appears to have a shady past -- so once again we are supposed to believe that the Granthams are so stupid that they'd continually hire terrible people to work for them when very obviously in the past they were smart enough to hire very good staff like Mrs. Patmore, Anna and Bates, Carson, Daisy, Alfred and Mrs. Hughes.  The character of Thomas remains static -- he's still a wretched man despite the fact that various members of the family and staff have shown compassion toward him in his time of despair at having been revealed to be homosexual in age when it could result in arrest and imprisonment.  Thomas has never been revealed to be a "stupid" man so one would assume that over time, he would change for the better as he realized that the entire world was not set against him -- nonetheless, once again he is thoroughly unpleasant this season and -- worse -- his character is now boring.
I cringe at the knowledge that later this year the godawful Shirley Maclaine and her godawful character will return -- she's like nails on chalkboard -- and this time she'll be toting along Paul Giamatti -- ugh!
I think the best thing we can all do now is enjoy re-watching the first three seasons which were entertaining despite being soap operaish -- because now it's just a soap opera and not terribly entertaining soap opera.
My husband and I jusy love watching Downton Abbey every week. If we miss an epidode, we find it very convenient that we can just purchase it from Amazon.
In my opinion, this is one of the best series I have ever seen.  Maggie Smith is incredible, as are all the rest of the cast.  Superb and addicitive.
The series continues to let the characters evolve and it is fascinating to watch as they respond to their past experiences.  Each person shows new depths and expansion of character development.

This season of Downton Abbey is a Must-See!
I would definitely purchase this package again.
So glad Amazon proved access to this superb show.
This season is shaping up like a soap opera.  Not so crazy about it but have been a follower and will continue on, tho less happy with the writing!

I love time pieces and this show makes me look forward to Sunday evening every week.  The wit and charm is so well written and even with some of the devastating losses of characters (which is life), the new romances and alliances keep me coming back for more!

For those who wrinkle up their noses and pronounce the series "a period-piece soap opera," I say the script itself is extraordinary. Example: the interaction between Lady Mary and the recent suitor, when she told him that as much as she might be filling his heart, her heart was still full of Matthew.... And the acting is superb--each one becomes the character, not overdoing emotions or reactions but a carefully nuanced portrayal of a scene or incident. Fellowes' genius has to be the cornerstone of this work, of course carried out by a talented cast and crew. Kudos to them all!

I did away w/ the Cable/Dish; so I could control my viewing, instead of opting for the best of a bad lot, only to have it visited upon me here as well. I suppose its the plague of people like Mr. Fellowes; that when ratings begin to drop, their knee-jerk reaction is to revert to the redundancy of tired scenarios while throwing in violence, making sure its once again targeted towards women. I fear that before the series ends he has insured that Anna, the moral compass of the story, will sadly find herself in the role of widow.

Seems to be a lot of unhappiness with season 4? Rightfully so! This season so far is about deep and profound loss. For those citing boring, well, I guess it could be if you have never lost a child or the love of your life or a parent 40 years too soon. I only used to watch this show because of I am a bit of an Anglophile, especially when it comes to all things Victorian - but wow have I been impressed with the characters and story matter so far! They are trying to fit in much more than the regular, albeit in creative, soap operatic and romantic novel dramatic lines. I can see how that disappoints more conservative viewers who are looking for comfort drama and the same old characters.

And while I try not to get too concerned about "reality" on a work of fiction, those viewers that get upset that character motivation seems unbelievable - you should take into consideration there may be lots of back stories in the course of the 6 months between the end of season 3 and the start of season 4. Thomas, like a real person, has evolved significantly over the course of the series and I would argue has the most depth of any character. Not only is it completely believable they would "keep" him on staff, he is the under-butler now, or number two in charge. It appeared Jimmy was ready to accept Thomas as a friend at the end of season 3, they now appear to be very close starting season 4. In the last year Thomas has made big strides in letting his guard down, accepting help and being vulnerable. He also had big moments like saving the cricket match while he somewhat gracefully acquiesced to Bate's return as the Lord's valet, had no small part in getting rid of the murderous O'Brien, and recently rescued George and Sybil from their abusive nanny! Haters hate, and I'm sure there is more twists coming for our hero/anti-hero but I for one am glad that they are not getting rid of one of the few deeply complex and developed characters on the show. Perhaps Thomas haters should try watching Duck Dynasty for something more along their tastes? ;)
I cherish this show and look forward to watching it on my iPad without any distractions.  This year has had some good and bad surprises but is top quality and timeless.

The rest of the crew INCLUDING TOM are just cut-outs....

I am so disappointed!!!!

Gosh, I am so surprised at the reviews that take apart the characters along with the story-lines, flummoxed by why the characters  didn't say this or that to make the plot more believable .. folks, this is ENTERTAINMENT.. if you want reality, go rent a copy of The Deer Hunter or Deliverance.

(Contains SPOILERS)
The premiere of the 4th season was disappointing enough---the absence of Matthew made the show feel hollow. I know Stevens wanted out, but Mathew was so pivotal a character, I just don't see why they couldn't get another actor to play the role.
But I continued to episode 4, and I think I'm done. There seems to be no growth or new dimensions to the characters, or the story lines. I'm completely indifferent to the cousin Rose-and truth be told, can't even recall how she ended up at Downton---a testament to how uninteresting she is. Mary being offered a marriage proposal; Anna's violent attack; Tom and that nutty maid (again)...The season is throwing all these developments without any kind of build-up or trajectory..so the viewer is left feeling completely detached from it all.

Truth be told, after I saw the Season 3 finale last year, my expectations for Season 4 were low. Matthew + Mary was the foundation of the show. Now that that foundation is gone, the show is floundering; and the writers are having a hard time propelling the show forward without a solid backbone. 2/5

I will continue to watch, but all the while I'll be pulling for a brighter outcome to all the current suffering and emotional distress.  Also, I'm still undecided if "Rose" has really added any value to the story line.  Having a "Mother" as homely as her character does, guess the powers that be thought they needed to find a "less than pretty" actress.....too bad.

I'm still a fan, but one that is longing for a "change of direction"!

I started watching Downton Abbey after season 1, but I've seen all seasons so far, thanks to amazon instant video. People kept talking about it, so I decided to get into it. It's a pretty good show once you get into it, but it does move a little bit slow at times, so be patient if you're just starting out. Purchase all of the seasons to get caught up. It's a great way to do it because it does tend to be addictive and with the instant videos you don't have to wait a week to see what happens next.
They leave us hanging  on a cliff in many episodes, which is the perfect way to do it---you just can't wait to see what happens next.
 Part of what is so interesting is the way people lived in England back then. Society's class system was strict and people staunchly followed the "rules" of their class, no matter where they stood . I can't help but laugh a little at the aristocrats of high society---they can't seem to function without their servants--at all. They can't dress or feed themselves, and God forbid they ever step foot in the kitchen to cook anything. They can't even get out of bed until they've been served breakfast.  Somehow, though, the servants don't seem to resent all of this catering to their "Ladies' and "Lords"  needs---they actually take great pride in their work, and except their station in life, seemingly without ever expecting more.
 The higher-ups actually treat their servants quite well and often include them in discussions about their difficulties, often asking advice.  It's amazing how everyone has been going along with the Status Quo for decades, and the "new world" they all face after WWI is upsetting to all. Things are slowly staring to change----let's see what happens next!
The acting and writing is all very good and Maggie Smith,of course, is a stand-out. She has some zinger lines that are delivered in a way that only Maggie Smith can do it. Hope they give her more. Enjoy!

I love this series and have enjoyed it very much each season! It is beautifully done with wonderful sets, period dress and cars.and The beautiful English landscape and village is only topped by the excellent English cast! It really draws you into a very special time and place.
love it. i would buy this againg. I hate though, you can't see it on pbs. online. it was better to when it was free.
This is a good wholesome show that can entertain all ages.  We have been hooked since the very first episode!
The show is enthralling, you never know what unexpected turn is coming up. Great cast, great show! I always look forward to the next show with anticipation.
I was stationed in England in the 80's. This is the best show on tv today and the quality of your program is great.

This may be the year the show jumps the shark.
Fourth  season begins with Ms Obian leaving in the night and Anna being raped... Mary and Mrs Hewes acting weird.  The characters have great and varying roles...no one is in the cat bird seat...they all have their trials, weaknesses, tribulations and fifteen minutes of fame.

Jumping the shark is too harsh but it's hard to see how this series is moving forward in a meaningful way, not to say I don't enjoy it or have a reason to keep watching.  I'm sure eventually I'll own the whole thing, to watch when I'm home with a cold.  Season 4 starts off with recycled Gosford Park, with the concert upstairs masking violent mayhem down.  The whole "we can't tell Mr. Bates because he will kill [what's-his-face] and then hang for it" is ridiculous and lazy and lame.  Is Bates really an out of control killer?  Really?  I thought the pie did it.  Oh, well, I'll keep watching for the costumes and lovely surroundings, but Downton Abbey is fast becoming a lazy soap opera.  My hair stylist told me the other day she watches General Hospital to keep up on the latest in men's hair cuts.  I so get it.
The story lines are a bit edgier this year in Downton Abbey, with more artificial drama.  The stories still grip and the episodes are quite enjoyable.  The scenery is great, as always.

It's such a simple story for everyone to relate to but so much meaning that comes with the different kinds of relationships told in the story. I find the cultural history brought with each episode fascinating and the stories riveting. I couldn't help but feel for each character because acting is superb. I'll be following Downton Abbey in the future.
MY HUSBAND IS NOT A MAN WHO LOVES SERIES.  BUT HE LOVED THIS !!!  THE ERA , THE CHARACTERS WAS WONDERFUL.  JUST UP MY ALLEY.

Absolutly love this show. Can't wait every time the season is over for the next one to air.
Hope it goes on for a long time. One of the best shows on TV
It is full of intrigue, history and romance.  Just when you think you know where things are headed, something happens that changes everything.
The cast is fantastic, the story & scenery is amazing.  Please keep it coming.  One of my favorite shows of all time!
Do not want to give anything away, but it doesn't seem like the same show.  Dramatic twists and turns, I love.  But the characters seem like they have turned into different people.

This is a show we've tried to get friends to watch and for the life of me they think it's supposed to be a Victorian era version of "Modern Family". Those devoted to the show may appear to be 'snobbish' but you tend to get embroiled in the characters and their individual struggles, both upstairs and down stairs.
My girl friend loves this show and we don't have cable. Being able to stream this makes her happy, which makes me happy. End of story ;)

Julian Fellows has run out of plot in season 4...Last night's 2 hour season opener flopped hard in my opinion. Wanted to go to bed before it was over. Even the usually good acting could have been phoned in. It was soapy, the micro plots predictable and simple. The main crisis, AGAIN with the  the 'control of Downton/heir issue'. Jesus, it's a 'dead Roman slave' that Fellows keeps flogging!
"Oh, leave-off! He's dead already!"  (Rome, HBO, Season 2)

I adore this series.  I cannot wait for future installments of this riveting story.  The characters are absolutely mesmerizing, the sets spectacular, and the costuming authentic and beautiful.  Even the choices of fabric are carefully made to be period specific.  The story line draws you in immediately, and there is never a sense in which it drags on or becomes tedious.  There is a sense of wonderment in reliving this amazing period through the characters, and historical understanding results as you experience life on the multiple levels of society.  I eagerly anticipate future episodes and recommend them heartily.
I like to see how the "other half" used to live and how the help found themselves in almost slave like atmosphere at times. Delightful, entertaining, capturing.

Perfection of detail except for one minor out of time period reference a band leader was referred to as black instead of negro or African which I don't think the black reference was used in the late. 20s picky picky otherwise perfect and timely in reference to ongoing and historical violence against women and disenfranchised thank you pbs

lots of class actors in this series. Maggie Smith is always a pleasure to watch. Only fault is that they tend to whip through the eras leaving little left for future series on the era that people seem addicted to.

Season Four is proving to be just as enjoyable a viewing experience as the previous seasons. The only reason for four stars instead of five is the increased family-unfriendly content of the last episode, too much promiscuity for family viewing.
My wife and I have enjoyed this show since the first season. Looking forward to how the cliffhanger is resolved!
Love it!  All the changes in season 3 made me unsure about how good season 4 could be, but so far it's great.

Season 4 of Downton Abbey started out sad with Matthew gone from the story as he was one of my favorite characters, but as it has developed, the other story lines within the main story have made it easier to accept the changes which is really why Downton keeps one so interested.  Love this series and because I missed the first two episodes of season 4, the downloads from Amazon caught me up right away!  I had forgotten to DVR the series.  Excellent! Can't miss this one!
Another great season! It only gets better and better. Season three ended with a twist but they introduce some new characters in season 4.

Season 4 -- such a disappointing and unworthy outing. Three seasons shaping characters and stoking emotional investment among your viewers --  just to have well-drawn characters suddenly act "uncharacteristically." Plot lines are becoming trite, thin, and transparent, and, in some cases, stillborn. The new season brings to mind a shotgun blast with enough pellets to strike every viewing demographic. A sad step down, I'd say. Even modestly educated folks know that Americans create entertainment -- and Brits create "art." The only remnant of British art visible in DA this season is costuming, and I fear that too will be compromised.

Season 4 starts off with the same force and panache as the previous seasons.  Season 4 seems destined to continue the journey deep into the core of the rapidly changing social climate of post war England.
Great family saga without sex or violence...amazing. All the characters are well developed and grow with life's twists and turns.

UK version of "One life to live"? Power, lust, envy, strife...no longer a "Feel Good" production as the beloved characters are killed or raped and the story line drastically thins out to resemble some bad soap opera from the seventies.
This is a riveting series overall.  I find the interaction between the classes amazing and so interesting to follow and know that this is actually how it was a century ago or less.

Shock and dismay over the calamitous turn of events for Anna.  I suppose this terrible scene - made all the worse by the sublime singing upstairs vs. the helpless screams downstairs - did happen on occasion and therefore is not out of bounds.  However, along with Matthews equally shocking death, the "Downton Abbey train" has veered off its tracks.  We are no longer sipping tea in the club car and looking out at a sublime landscape.  Instead, we see a mangled body (Matthew)and a raped woman (Anna), utterly destroying the veneer of order and impeccability we had been enjoying hitherto.
I can appreciate why the audiences feel betrayed - our own vestigial innocence blind-sided!
This season is awesome ! I love the characters and the many new twists and turns ! Please get this !!

Seasons 1 - 3 were great!  I cancelled my pre-order for Season 4 as, unfortunately, the writers have lost track of what really made this episode so special.  It is now just sensationalism and "American soap opera" at it's worst.  The killing of Matthew was a big mistake as his marriage to Lady Mary, with new baby, was just getting on track.  The rape of Anna, a sweet and popular character, is the last straw as far as my wife and I are concerned.  This series used to make us feel good and was very interesting to watch... now it has become cheap and is no longer an uplifting series... too bad.  It didn't have to be this way...
I have to hand it to the producers and especially the writers. The series continues to maintain its balanced picture of cultural change and traditional sensibilities.
It is Excellent all the way around! Great scenery story acting ... writing ... so well done in every way.
All of the characters are intriguing, the locations are spectacular, I love the story line and the music takes me to a different place.
Downton Abbey for the win. Always entertaining. Period drama is surprisingly riveting with great story lines. You will like it best if you start with season 1 and view them in order.

Not interested in watching 4th Season.
thank you anyway..
rosemary price

Love Maggie Smith and enjoyed Dame Kiri Te Kanawa
I will admit an addiction to the show - but darned if I can figure out why at this point.
It's been interesting to watch the character development of the actors. They all do so well and have created a believable story.

Would recommend this series to anyone who is looking for clever plots set in historically accurate settings with period perfect costumes.  The actors give stellar performances and are engaging without being trite or contrived. A pure indulgence.
Love the show!  Look forward to every episode. I enjoy the time it's takes place and the characters, cloths, castle, and the story.
I never want it to end, the acting and the story are superb.  Love, Love Love it! Thank you for entertaining me!

I'm so glad Mary found her spirit again. Now things will get interesting. I do think it was rather cunning of her father to "allow" Mary to be in her grief so he could have control of the estate; and glad that he overcame his ego.

Love it. Please take care of all my favorite characters. Consistent with its earlier seasons regarding the depth of characterization. Well chosen caste who performs beautifully - so far. Please send the next episode IMMEDIATELY. Don't make me wait!

Well, I have to admit, my friends said I have to watch this show. I saw an episode during a PBS fund raiser and decided to watch the show. I was hooked immediately. I find it interesting to see how things were back then. People are people no matter what the class. But their stories are worth watching. Consider me hooked and I look forward to more episodes.
I have loved this show since the beginning. We have not been where we could view it on TV these past few months and we are so glad to be able to down load it and view it on Amazon.
As like many others I started watching this series on my amazon prime and by the time I got to season 4 I was so hooked I decided to buy the whole dvd set so I could watch it again

Rebuilding after the death of the most popular and dare I say main character is hard. I would like to see downtown make it past WWII if they can push that far ahead, however to go that far several more characters will have to come and go. Still disappointed one of the characters is up to his old tricks again. One would have though he would have out grown them by now.

I heard good things but didn't know anything about this, just bought it on a Black Friday special.  A friend was "stuck" at my place while her flights were cancelled for days at a time, and we began a 33-hour Downton Abbey Marathon.  At first we thought about switching to something else, we had trouble with the English, accents and word use, and so many characters!  Suddenly, it all came together and we were HOOKED!  Brilliant - very well written, incredible pace introducing some history with wit and a great story.  Can't wait to start watching the next season!  I expected better quality from Blue-ray, however, as at time the sound track gets a little off from the video track and it's quite annoying, but the show is so good even that becomes forgivable.
The great story continues, with some new, unexpected twists! Some new players as well to add to the fun. Love it, as always!

Fantastcally well done and acted,  keeps one waiting for the next everytime.
Beautiful settins , lovely accents. An insight into that era.
I am totally hooked on this series but was out of the country when season 5 began. Thanks to Amazon I was able to catch up on the characters' lives

There wasn't enough Thomas for me (I love his wickedness and the kind heart he keeps hidden) after the first show.  Other characters come and go;  I found Cora's brother confusing.  No sociopathic American playboy would change so drastically from the picture that's been painted of him.  Lord G is just annoying in the first few episodes, then thankfully charges off for a time.  Didn't like what happened to Anna, and Rose goes from overactingly annoying to being the bright spot.  Nice to see Mary thaw, Edith be stupid, and Mrs. Patmore, one of my favorite characters may be preparing to leave so Daisy can take over?  The two old ladies of Downton are great as usual.  The Xmas special IS in the UK version, despite what other reviewers say, so don't go by their misinformation.
I am hooked on Downton Abbey & had missed this episode. I wouldn't allow anyone to talk about it because I didn't want any spoilers.

I love Downton and this episode didn't necessarily disappoint, but there are some disturbing developments, not unlike some of the early episodes in the first season that seemed more thrown in to make the story more sensational than developing naturally.  I guess the writers have to come up with something to keep the story going and keep it from getting too boring, but it does seem contrived at times.

I was worried that this season would be a disappointment after Matthew's death, but the intrigue and character and plot twists continue with a vengeance!  Maggie Smith continues to delight as the indomitable matriarch; the character of Robert is still stuffy and incompetent; Mary grows softer and stronger, simultaneously; Anna and Bates continue to be innocent victims of others' evildoings, etc.  The intermingling of the upstairs and downstairs lives is captivating, and the plot goes on and on!  I love it!
... and I am as hooked as ever.  I bought the shows on Amazon so my partner and I could have early access to them.
Complex characters, wonderful writing with unpredictable story lines plus extreme attention to detail and historical accuracy make this a wonderful show. It is definitely "can't miss" tv!

One of the Best shows I have watched, and I have watched nearly all of them in the past 10 years...Do your self a favor, watch Season 1 and be patient, for there are very few, if any, great shows out there without any gratuitous sex, violence, and drugs and alcohol....This deserves the awards it has won and more...Very good acting, and Historically intact.
Fritz
Downtun Abbey once again does not disappoint.  Look forward to each episode. Enjoying the new characters but still miss Matthew
I love the story line, it makes you fall in love with the characters. The actors do a great job every episode.
Great show. Wonderful backdrop and great plot. Would recommend to any person who likes historical drama! Great start to an interesting season.
I love Downton Abbey. I love how it follows the service people as well as those in the house. It's captivating
Once you start watching Downton you are hooked. The characters are complex but life was simple as well as very structured in the upper class in this time period.

The two hour premiere of this Season reintroduced us to our favorite characters, upstairs and down, to see what they were up to. There are some missing faces this season, some more missed than others. But new characters are arriving on the scene. Mary is in mourning but it appears may be jolted out of it by a charming new friend. Edith grows more interesting with her mature love and agreeable man, but will her father ever accept him? He's not landed gentry. The dowager duchess is as pithy and witty as usual. Matthew's mother looks better in her new hairstyle. Fun to know how Carson loved and lost. Am loving the 1920's fashions - the twenties offer so much fun and style. Looks like some juicy twists and a promising season.

Even though the first two episodes were rather dull---we should have known--Mr. Fellowes loves a sharp twist, doesn't he? But Poor-Poor Anna!!!!!!!!  What a predicament-she is in---her devotion to Bates will keep that dirty bastard who attacked her out and happily attacking more innocent people!!!!  Or will it? Will someone give him what he deserves???? I hope so!!!

Yea... its getting pretty cheezy and way to violent . somehow i just don't care about anyone in it anymore.  kind of nauseating. and if Bates gets revenge and goes to jail that might make it interesting...

Cconsidering Bates actually helped Thomas last season and saved his butt.  Consider that O'Brien was put in her place with respect to her secret of the soap.  You would think the character of Thomas would surely have changed for the better.  Instead we get another season of a mean-spirited Thomas.  WHY?  I think the audience would have welcomed a nicer Thomas and many of us actually looked for him to be nicer and kinder, especially since O'Brien sneaked off into the night.
The new maid could have surely come on board to create problems without Thomas.
I find Cora the most boring of characters in all seasons.  How is it possible for both Cora and his Lordship to be that dumb?  Thought by now they would have gained insight into devious characters serving and WHY would they suddenly believe a new maid depicting Anna as anything but honest?  That should have been nipped in the bud upon saying.  Can't imaging any lady of the house being that stupid.  Season 4 seems to be a repeat of other seasons.  Can it be our DA Jullian Fellows is out of ideas?  It is bad enough Matthew is gone, but a repeat of the same old, same old!
What I do love and have loved from the beginning is Dame Maggie Smith (Queen of the double-take) who has been given the best lines in every season.  What a fantastic actress!  Love that woman.  Mary is a bit boring and needs to get her spirit up.  She needs to be more fiesty.
I fear this season may be a wash.
I enjoyed the way the plot kept me interested to the end. I liked how easy it is to order.
If the show is going to keep in this direction I will stop watching. I will watch a few more episodes before I make my decision.
I love the program and custom for the charathers and the tme period to each season. I would watch this program over and over.

A great program continues another season. The writers are excellent,  the acting is outstanding and the
setting is very interesting.  Just a wonderful series to watch.
Even though one of the main characters was missing it was still enjoyable.  The scenery and costumes are fun to watch also.

Love the detail placed on duplicating this period of time.  The viewer is able to fully grasp the extravagance of the lifestyles lived.  Exciting and dramatic plots that clearly hold the viewers attention.

Oh it is good to understand more about how we were... and hopefully learn why traditions ARE important...but choose the right ones and the ones where we all win, like do unto others as you would have others do unto you!!!
Love the series and how it shows that they had the same problems in their time as we do today!

This program is always engaging.  It's a tremendous setting populated with characters you'll love and characters you must hate.  It's comedic, but not a comedy.  Moreover, it's a drama and a history lesson that will enlighten and entertain audiences everywhere.
I love this series. Could not wait until the new season started. I am a true fan. Please continue to carry this series.
Takes me back to a time of lovely refinement. Beautifully filmed. Characters with big hearts always leaving me wanting more.

Downton Abbey has the world watching and there is nothing in these characters of the turn of the century more than outstanding and the series in all always takes me into this world and clamming for more.
One of the best shows ever and my husband and I enjoy watching it together.  I love having it through Amazon Prime so that we can watch it when we are BOTH home and able to enjoy it.
Wonderful cast. Lovely costumes. I want to visit while filming! Definitely an addictive show. Can't wait for my sisters to watch it.

I had a few friends recommend this show and I'm glad I watched this - after watching the first 3 seasons over a weekend. This is a great show with dynamic characters and multiple plot lines. I'm a fan.
Love it Love it. We look forward to all of these movies. It is amazing to look forward to the next one.

I was very happy to see the Grantham family, the Countess and the others back. However, the opening series felt more like a soap opera than I remembered the past seasons. I had heard about the rape of Anna through spoiler alerts last year. Is the series running out of ideas? Seems as if it was searching for what to do, now that "Matthew" is off the show. Thomas continues to be annoying. Cora is starting to come across as not particularly smart (does she really believe Thomas' disparaging comments about Anna?), versus a society woman trapped in the  mores of British aristocracy. I hope that the pace quickens, along with more depth given to the characters. What are your views?
Love the show!  The contrast of upstairs/downstairs and the drama of life!  Castle and clothing are gorgeous, and lend a look into a lifestyle rarely seen by most!
Filmed on location, great casting and beautifully executed!  The character development is well done and the story is fascinating.  Huge fan!!

Without giving any spoilers, the theme of Downton Abby seems to be developing along the lines of "when bad things happen to good people, we just have to do our best to get on with it." If the acting and the production values were not so good...and the characters so consistently engaging, this would be a very depressing show! As it is, I have to steel myself to watch each episode, but I do it, and I am, in the end, always glad I did :)
Been watching every episode since season 1. Surprises,surprises and wow so unexpected.romance,revege,secrets,and desire all in the Grand Manor.you will definitly get hooked

I have watched the first three episodes and so far have been disappointed.  The writing seems superficial and they are rehashing plots.  It seems more like a soap opera now.

I love Downton Abbey's first three seasons.  The stories were interesting and entertaining.  You felt like you were a part of Downton Abbey and sympathized with the characters. Now it just borders on boring.  I will continue to watch, however, in hopes that it improves.

DA gets 5 stars because it is a stellar and transcendant take me back in time kind of story.  Every character remains sooooo civilized whenever they do or say something something naughty.  I would love to be invisible at one of their dinner parties.
I saw the whole of season 4 before it came out on PBS locally, thinking I was catching up and ready to see season 5 on PBS.  I know what's happening before all my friends!
I think the loss of Matthew, a KEY character, has really hurt the story line. I really liked the way things were happening in season 3 and have been disappointed with the beginning of season 4.
Love it but hated that Anna got assaulted!!  Seemed different without Dan Stevens.  Need a saucy new romance for Mary.  Love this show...NEVER MISS IT!!!
This show is absolutely amazing and very well done. My favorite period piece yet! I hope the show never ends!
Can't wait to see Season 4 in its entirety.  I think it will be very difficult to watch one episode at a time.  Really looking forward to it ..

This season is off to a good start (I hope...considering the quandary Anna is in now).  I hated that two of my favorite characters were written off in Season 3 but I understand that their contracts had expired & they wanted out.  I am looking forward to where Season 4 will take us!
What a delightful season. I just started watching and was excited to see Season 4. Not to be disappointed the fourth season is great also
Great sets.  You feel right in that time period.  Always love the characters and the depth that you get from a great series.
I was alittle shocked at the turn of events in this episode but am anxious to see how the writers are going to deal with them.  Don't want to spoil any thing for views.
Another Amazing Season! Controversial Storyline Makes For Suspense Of Next Episode. Can't Wait For New Characters To Appear And Hopefully Some Previous  Ones CoMe Back.

This was deceiving on Amazon. This is actually the second hour of the first episode. I watched that whole thing on TV, but missed the second episode that came out last week, which is listed here as Episode 3.
Otherwise this was a great second-half kick off to the season.

I brought 1 & 2 two episodes thinking I missed the first night and when I started to watch them tonight I thought hey this was last Sunday. So I brought Episode 3 which was shocking when not 1 single person came down to check why Anna took so long. Until Sunday the 19...

Bumbling idiot his lordship sustains in his cluelessness.  Why did Matthew go and not he, yikes!  Brutal, very disturbling rape scene, you won't sleep once you watch this one, then a cover up... its absolutely absurd!  Skanky maid after Branson appears to have scored.  Very disappointing couple of episodes so far!
Historical, rich  and great story line -- characters are very well developed and easy to believe.  Two great stories to follow!

I am such a Downton Abbey fan and this season is horrible.  So Boring!  The plot is so thin and the characters have become completely one dementional.  The whole thing is so predictable..."omg, Mary is sad, will she ever get over it?...I don't know, I'm riveted trying to figure out what's next..."

In addition to the lameness of the interactions, I am completely bothered by how inauthentic the whole thing has become.  It basically takes our modern values and redacts them into history, creating situations and perspectives that these characters NEVER would credibly have in their day.  The whole thing basically becomes a big game of dress up, acting out a weak screen play in fabulous clothes...  BUT, the clothes are fabulous, so I do still watch :)
Instant video version was in constant buffering mode.  It took nearly 2 hours to view the one hour video.  What's up with that?

I had already seen the season-opening 2 hour "episode" last week on PBS and was under the impression that the next "episode," as shown on Amazon.com was going to be "episode no. 2."  I ordered it on Amazon and watched a few minutes of it thinking it was some sort of a review but then realized that it was the 2nd hour of the first 2 hour showing on PBS!  I then went to episode 3, rented it and enjoyed the hour long 3rd episode show.
A refund would be nice.
Thanks.
Paul
Downton Abbey is wonderful!  I can't wait until the entire season is available for purchase.  This is one of my favorite programs.
I love this show, the characters, costumes and of course the grand house! The plot twists and turns will surely continue in season 4!!
It's just not at the level season 1,2,3 ... But it's good enough to watch if only to continue seeing how story line continue end or begin.
So exciting to be watching Downton Abbey again.  I love all the characters in this show.  Can't wait to see the next episode!

First rate production, acting, script, story-line. This is addicting! After watching the Forsyte Saga, I was not looking forward to what I felt would be a step down, and not at all comforted by the fact that every one was raving about it. True, Downton is no Forsyte, but it is the most scintillating period soap-opera ever on television. Some times I did want to strangle the folks upstairs, but one is meant to find their concerns alarmingly trivial and at the same time, their sorrows run deep and they mostly mean good. The whole affair might be one big old cliche, but a thoughtful and often witty script freshens  the "upstairs, downstairs" premise, and Maggie Smith is a delight to watch; one savors her every twitch and bob. The entire cast shines. One feels one is living at the Abbey, which is a wonderful place to be.
We love series, unfortunately it starts to look like an American soap opera...repetitive... uninteresting... Time to end it... do something else.
In a word "FANTASTIC"!!!!! love love love it!!!! Takes me away from all the hustle and bustle and puts my mind in a relaxing mood.
I only gave season 4 a 4 star rating because it didn't contain enough episodes. It needed to be longer.

I have been such a huge fan of Downton Abbey. This story is so important to me as a member of the Spencer family and relation to the current Earl of Spencer (also sharing the same full name as my father) at the family estate in Althrop. Yet after the fabulous season 3, and cliff hanger, season 4 was such a let down. Instead of revealing plot for those who have not seen season 4.. All I will say is that this season the plot will center around two key events. One surrounding Anna Bates (chamber maid) married to John Bates (butler/valet)... which after the sadness, drama of previous seasons of following these two characters.. was the plot twist really realistic or necessary? The other concerns lady Edith However some of the great characters are just not even developed in season 4. BOO! Personally I was shocked that the incredible acting of Rob James Collier as Thomas Barrows was not showcased after season 3. Meaning after the incident between Thomas and Jimmy, and Thomas profound lonliness and determination to up in class ranks, that they did not develop a plot around him. Was this because O'brien left the show? Which was also awful. She was essential to the plot. So sad. The other characters of Daisy, Mrs. Pattmore etc. are hardly developed this season. And the love interest of Jack Ross for Lady Rose is sort of funny and odd choice for plot... not to mention his vocal styling is completely wrong for the period. AKA mediocre. Also Kiri Te Kanawa as Nellie Melba? REALLY? pleassssssse. LOL Not to mention Nellie Melba would have never sung in a private home, not to mention the repertoire choice was mediocre. How about Mary's development? WOW not well thought out. Such a let down!! A bit insulted after the great writing from the previous 3 seasons!. Fans deserve better. It feels like this was slapped together quickly. The final Xmas episode is sort laughable too with the plot at Buckingham Palace. It would have been much more interesting to have filmed in NYC during the jazz age. esp with more involvement from Shirley MacClaine who does a splendid job as usual. Luke warm rating. J. R. is the author of: Lady Liberty: The Definitive Julie London Handbook

One of the things I like about Downton Abbey is its focus on old/new England. The family pulls together to help each other in spite of the differences in generational thinking and customs. Robert and Mary are about to bang head-on with the women's property issue. Should be an exciting season.
It seems like some of the themes are a bit repetitive of prior seasons, but overall I still enjoy watching.
Keep them coming please.  Wonderful story with very colorful characters.  Very good period piece.  Can't wait for the next episode.
Though I do get a little tired of Mary's sadsack routine...still I'm waiting eagerly for the next installment! This is the first series I've enjoyed in a really long time.
very nice entertainment.  My wife and I have watched all the seasons so far.  We like this one just as much as the others.
Even after four seasons it continues to keep my interest and I care about the characters and their ongoing lives.
Love the series, wonderful acting.  The stories really draw you in.  I love all the characters, even the mean ones. lol

Happy to see my old friends again. Great writing, great characters. Eagerly awaiting the next episode.

Was disappointed that this was not free to Prime members, though.

Even with some favorite characters gone, new ones with interesting story lines and potential definitely fill in any gaps. The story line continues to be fresh and evolving, acting superb, costumes and sets flawless.
Enjoyed Downton Abbey very much was glad to catch up so we can watch the regular series on schedule for the rest of the season.
Great show. Great writing and acting.  I love keeping up with the rich and royal of England. It is to load onto my Kindle.  Thanks.

The show was very well done. Although I was a little disappointed at the deception of the servants. I suppose that could have been the case. This is a great series for binging season one through season four if you haven't seen it.
This is a great show from start to current. Must have patience for the large number of characters you will be introduced to.

I am hopelessly addicted to this marvelous program and can't wait to continue following the story of the Crawley family and their servants.  It is worth upgrading to the HD as visually, this show is gorgeous between the beautiful home and the lavish wardrobe.  I like that purchasing the Season Pass gives me early access to the last few episodes of the new season.  To anyone who has hesitated to give Downton Abbey a try - I encourage you to start with Season 1 and watch at least the first two or three episodes, and I guarantee you will be as addicted as the rest of us!

Love this show!  Love the historical accuracy.  Love the beautiful sets and costumes.  Love that this show encourages one to be more graceful, reserved, charming, and gallant.  It brings back an era where manners and decency mattered.  Something our present society is sorely lacking.  Ettiquette!  If you enjoy Jane Austen you will find Downtown quite satisfying. Brew a cup of tea, sit back, and savor.
If you've been luck enough to have watched then you already know how masterful and captivating Dowton is! If you haven't watched yet, then by all means, watch it!!!
Here we go again with the lives of the rich compared to the downstairs servants combined with the status of women at that time  etc. Hard not to get wrapped up in all the characters!
Set in late 1800 in England with lovely period costumes and fascinating characters in a castle with servants downstairs and family upstairs there is drama aplenty. Well written and excellent acting.
I love everything about this show!!  I feel like I am a part of the family (or servants) and could have easily enjoyed living during this time period, at least the way they portray it!!
I think this show rocks, and I think this Season is perfect. Go Downton Abbey! This is the best season, by far.
This show draws you into the lives if the characters!  You have the feeling that they are all part if your extended family-
The  interesting characters, the intelligent and witty dialogue, the story lines that move just quickly enough, and the clothing and the acting are all sublime.
They are doing a wonderful job of showing the changes in class separation/division after WW1, as well as changes socially and culturally.  Really a great series!
I am totally hooked on this show!  Hope it continues forever!  The characters and story line are awesome!  So glad friends told me about it!

Also, other story lines are becoming bolder and presenting more controversy than  any previous seasons...

The story telling is great and can't wait to the next week to see what is happening to my favorite people,, and find myself drawn in,,and now there is poor Anna,that I'm worried about!!!!

With its fidelity to a more genteel time period, this series is downright refreshing in its complexity sans overt sex and violence--and with a plot that keeps twisting to highlight the social and political  tensions of the day. But don't be fooled by the prudent costuming--there's plenty of desire and dark inclination to keep viewers wondering what's next.
Characters, storyline, setting, and overall best practice is exemplified in this series.  I don't watch much TV but this is a show I make time to see!

Downton Abbey continues to evolve in an exciting high drama in this  portrail of nobility life... The plot continues with unexpected twists and turns, it met my expectations and I am looking forward to the next episode.

I love this show.  I love the time period. I can't wait to see what Mary is going to do now with the shares of the land and business that Matthew left to her. Daddy wasn't to happy about that. I would have loved to live in that period. Can't wait to see what happens next.

and since it's also impossible for me to un-subscribe to Season 4, I won't be watching it, which means I won't be paying to watch it; therefore it will sit in my computer waiting for me for the rest of my life.

Downton Abbey is never dull, I will give them that.  They killed off two of my favorite characters last season (which I could live with, albeit sadly).  Now they have raped another of my favorite characters (which I, and it seems others, cannot live with).  This is the type of plot one expects from a dying TV series, not from one which keeps receiving more accolades at every turn.  Call it sensationalism, call it cruelty, call it what you will, but I'm not supporting their ratings anymore.  Downton has the cast, crew, costumes and (we hoped) the creative brains to make a nice long run of it as a series...the rape scene in Episode 3 was quite simply overkill, unnecessary, and off-putting.

I decided to purchase this online instead of taking up more space in my home with yet another disc.  Both the picture quality and streaming is exceptionally high.

As far as Downton Abbey Season 4 it's off to a great start and I look forward to more unexpected twists and turn.

Thomas and whoever he pairs with to hurt others, is getting just too much. Either change him to a good guy or fire or kill him off.  I like characters who are interesting, not just mean.

Matthew should have replaced with another actor rather than kill him off. His character is very missed.

Show more of the children.

Can't they give Edith a true eligible man?

I have to agree with "Just Bill", he couldn't have said it better. It started out as a very classy show, more than the mundane drivel we're used to being served. Through Season 3 it was a good show, however Season 4 started off badly with an un-necessary rape of Anna. There was no reason to go this direction, unless plots are getting hard to come up with and you can watch any soap opera on tv and be just as well served. Julian Fellowes, who started off as quite a good writer, has now sunk to about as low as any writer can get. We need movies to lift our spirits, not needing to watch what we can see any night on the news shows. So sorry, Downton, you had a good short run, but no longer do you meet my criteria for something worth watching.! I had pre-ordered a dvd and Blu-ray of season 4, which I have now cancelled.
And Mary still grieves for Matthew. Much is going on at Downtown both above and below stairs. First rate, but I still miss Matthew.
My wife got me hooked on this show back in Season 1...  Love the show, the story line, the plot, the scenery, everything!

Fantastic series!!!  I can hardly wait for each new episode.  They never disappoint!!

Lorra

I have always loved British aristocrat type movies and Downton Abbey is one of my favorites of all times. I love all the characters, the wardrobes, storyline, old castles and everything about it.  It is believable with beautiful people as well as poor uneducated but very lovable people  and keeps my interest.  I hate for it to end,

After viewing four episodes of season 4, I am cancelling my DVD order. Some reviews have said things like meh, not interested, tired, etc. and I agree. It seems that the writers tried to Americanize the story. Somehow, the writers forgot that we watched for the simpler time. If I want to see violence I can watch a dozen different shows in the USA so maybe that is what I will do,,,not.

It is sad that the show did not make it the standard five years before toileting. We know it happens, I had just hoped that it would not happen for a few more seasons. Oh well, it is just a tv show, there are many more important things in life.

Killing off Matthew is a MAJOR err on the part of the producers and directors. The elders in this season are becoming comical instead of compelling. The fury to add NEW characters to this season are seem to be shallow and of no real interest. Let's face it, in the past episodes we cared about the good guys and despised the the mean-spirited, corrupt characters. Now we're beginning to think it's the writers who are mean-spirited and struggling to find issues to keep the series going.

It would have been far more entertaining to see Tom and Matthew work together to save the Abbey and to work for women's rights in merry old England. It would have been far more entertaining to see the doctor and Matthew's mother become an item and work together. It would be far more entertaining to see Daisy become the landowner of her father-in-laws estate and build to something large and in competition to the Abbey or at least the Abbey needing her services.

The niece or whoever she is, is just plain boring, we don't care if someone would kidnap her. In fact, please do we've had enough already.

Season Four is starting off with a whimper.  Good thing Sherlock is beginning soon.
Love Season 4! It was like going back home after being away for awhile.  Also helps me to get through those long workouts Ive been putting off!
I like the characters, the setting of the actual castle and the writing.  Very good show.  However, I hate it when you kill off a character.

I love the characters and enjoy learning about the interactions between the different  "classes" of people.  It is so nice to watch a show without constant sexual connotations or slang and bad language as a whole.  It is like reading a good book and feeling like you know the people.
I couldn't wait for season 4 to come out and it doesnt disappoint! what a show! Full of all the Downton Abbey characters we have come to love.

Downton Abbey is a wonderful, compelling series.  Please start from the beginning if you have not yet entered this enchanting creation.  I was absolutely crushed after the loss of two principal characters in season 3 and was concerned about where season 4 would take this story.  Thank you so much for allowing the darkness of grief but providing a glimpse of sunshine...

I do not know what it is about British television series on the society's traditional class differences and dramas. It is enthralling, however, and I am caught up in the fourth season. I am not sure whether it's a flaw or an advantage that we can already see the writing on the wall for a couple of characters. To see whether our hunches become realized or not will keep me, at least, returning to watch the following episodes!
Downton Abbey is amazing with its believable characters, intelligent and often witty dialogue. I wait every week gor the newest episode!

Quality all the way around, acting, scenery, script.  Has encouraged me to go back and watch other Masterpiece Classics - which have all been of similar caliber with the exception of Mansfield Park, which they tried to do in one episode and just didn't get the characters developed - seemed trivial.
It is a pleasure to watch something real with no inane content sexual or violent  Something clean that everyone can watch

This new season is horrific.  The plotline bounces from one character to another, and from one scene to another within seconds. No story or character development at all.  I am a huge fan,  but this new season is unwatchable.
Love this show.. Can't wait to watch each new season. The plot keeps changing and keeps the viewer interested. I pay to watch it on my kindle.
Love it.  10 digits up!  This show is very addictive.  I thought my coffee was addictive; but boy was I in for a Great Suprise.

This is very much a soap opera, but it is a fun one.  The writing is witty; the actors deliver impeccably; the sets are fabulous;  and the costumes are gorgeous.  I don't miss an episode, but it is, nevertheless, a soap opera - complete with pregnant pauses and rapid shifts to different scenes.

The characters are believable.  So believable that when a certain character  died at the end of season three I was emotionally devastated and decided in anger that I would never watch the show again.  I really felt badly for the Brits, I mean, Christmas Eve?  That's just not right.
I watch the show.  My friends ALL watch the show.  My friends' husbands all watch the show.  (That's the Unbelievable part.)
It's a marvelous drama, sometimes a mystery, often a cliff hanger and DA always leaves one highly anticipating the next episode.
I actually do have a life as do my friends.  But this is one part that is just a jewel.
The best of this type period that I have ever  watched. Every week I wait for the events with anticipation.
Great acting, love story line. Love how they depict actual events from history. I can't wait for more seasons to come.

There is no doubt that Jullian Fellowes can spin a yarn, but fear has clouded his artistry.  I think the hardest reality to face is that the writer did not trust his fans; and that is such a shame.  After loosing Dan Stevens (Matthew Crawley), fans were dismayed and hurt; but that was not Follows fault.  He did his best to secure the actor but in the end, Mathew Crawley must be killed off.

Now, this adds a great deal of writing possibilities for season 4, as all the fans go through the grieving process along with the characters of the show.  So, what shouldn't happen?  Exactly what did happen...another shock!  While rising from the loss of two beloved characters, we have to suffer more.  Why add another shock?  Well, to get our minds off of Mathew's death, of course.  This was a mistake, for sure; and one that could have been avoided if Julian Fellowes had been more trusting.  In turn, I believe he has lost the trust of many fans.

Then too,  I think the development of characters is lacking, as they seem to be caught up in a whirlpool type of development which leaves the audience feeling a deja vu experience.  All of which adds up to Downton heading in the direction of, and allow me to coin a phrase from season one, "the slippery slope."

I'll not desert the sinking ship, yet.  Perhaps it may still float.  Time will tell if this passenger stays aboard until season 4 docks.
Great writing, acting, character development, costumes and setting. It doesn't get any better than that! Make sure you start from the begining.
Great Series with an  awesome story line,  you just becone involved with the characters,  I just love it and highly recommend it.
Downton Abbey continues with great character development and surprising twists and turns...the Rape of Anna sets the stage for the development of her relationship with Bates

I really liked this drama series until last season when they started killing off the best characters. In addition, the characters that everyone loves to hate continually come out on top, which is so frustrating. Then, during the third UK version episode, more bad things happen to a favorite character. The writer decided that the characters were at a stand still and needed something to shake things up. But, I just can't take it anymore! So, no more Downton for me! We don't have cable and didn't watch much TV to start with, but I clearly take my TV watching too seriously!
This video streamed very well. I have only had very few issues with buffering and truly enjoyed watching the series on Amazon. (thanks to Prime :D).
it's the only show that our whole family watches together. we look forward to it, and won't watch it until we can all sit down and watch it together.
The representation of the time period in England was accurate from the clothing, customs and from a historical perspective.  The acting was excellent!

Along with some new characters, one of whom is the new Ladies Maid who's up to something, Mary finally is pulling out of a mourning stupor.  Lady Edith's love is planning a drastic action in order to marry her.  That's all I'll tell.
The story is a lovely portrait of early 20th century life in England.  Characters are totally wonderful.  Watch it, you'll love it.
Story line is terrible. Plot is going downhill fast. Season 1 is the best by far. Sad for us fans.

I love this show. Superb acting, excellent writing, beautiful costumes...

If you're a die-hard action fan, can't live without your ironic humor or need a show with lots of "edge", this show is not for you.

Downton Abby continues to prove that great productions do not need any in your face nudity, profanity, violence and so on. I find the lack of this stuff in this program quite refreshing. And, I must commend the writers and producers for their continuing efforts at maintaining this programs high quality and standards. On the down side, it does seem to me that the Season Four drama may be drifting to the heavy side. If hopefully there is a Season Five, you may wish to explore other avenues.
Best show I've seen in years! I'm so glad it's back. I only wish I didn't have to wait for each episode.
Love this show. I believe season 4 will have lots of drama and surprises in store for the viewers. Wish I didn't have to wait a week for each episode
I love this series!! Can't wait to watch it every Sunday evening, last weeks was the best ever as far as I'm concerned!

With the break after Season 3 and having the time to let the Downton Abbey obsession fade, I wasn't sure I'd have the same fascination with Season 4.  Especially since 'Matthew' was killed  -  I did not like that turn of events at all!  But no such luck.  I'm doomed to devote yet another time slot to this show.  We are just as captivated by the new season as ever.  I just love the clothes, the interiors,  the exterior shots . . .  the characters,  the attention to details . . .  .  and of course we really enjoy the absence of the over the top / in your face use of violence, sex and depravity to try to make a story interesting!  My husband & I still love Downton Abbey and look forward to watching the next episode.

Beautiful to watch. Great story and characters.
Well done!! We enjoy watching two or three times just to catch the little nuances. This is the best show on television by far!
Having now watched season's one thru four. and the first two eposedoes of season five. All I have to say is that each season get's better and better. Season five can not get here soon enough.
Catching up with all the hoopla over this show and I must admit, I just love it.  Hope you try it as well.
Very good start to the season.  You could feel the sadness with the loss of Matthew. Can't wait to see more episodes

I love anything British, royal history or fiction, life and times of it all. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the same.
Very well written and acted.  I can't wait to see how this season plays out.  Just like a good book....I never want it to end!

Have you noticed that on some posting sites of new releases of books or movies, etc., there comes a successive stream of short and sing-songy little gushes (4 or 5 stars) for the subject item?  They usually come at the beginning and notably after someone posts a negative review, especially one which gains support.  I see this happening here.  It appears the product's marketing people attempt to recover the negative rating and defer further influence with these high rated, generic raves.  That they come minutes apart in a herd makes it a further questionable "coincidence."  Meanwhile, the challenging post is pushed out of view from the latest page. It appears to be a damage control system in place, and it does consistently appear.

The subject product, this latest series, and the series as a whole has certainly become a mixed bag, trending down.  THIS IS A NEGATIVE POST. Now, watch the "fixers" come out en mass.

I had heard nothing but great reviews on this series so while searching Amazon video in Nov 2013 I happened to see it I decided to watch it. I was only going to watch a couple but I was hooked after the first 3-4! I ended up watching all the series over the course of few weeks I could not wait for it to start back up this year! I don't get PBS in my satellite package so I still have to watch it on Amazon video but I don't mind it's just like watching it on smaller tv on my iPad plus Amazon notifies me it's ready to watch! The long awaited season 4 of Downton Abbey is here and it did not disappoint.  Once again the writers have brought us, the viewers, in to an intimate relationship with all of the beloved characters.  Can not wait for more.
Very well done and engaging. It exhibits proper and polite behavior (for the most part), people are respectful, they pull up their pants and no foul language
